organization.name: Meals on Wheels and More
organization.description: Supports the health and independence of the older adult populations of Whatcom and San Juan Counties by providing nutritious food, social connection, and nutrition education.

organization.name: Crisis Connections
organization.description: One of the oldest Crisis Lines in the nation, and home to programs focused on serving the emotional and physical needs of individuals across Washington State.

organization.name: Kelly Services Bellingham
organization.description: A local division of Kelly Services, providing staffing support and jobs.

organization.name: Southside Community Meal
organization.description: Everyone is invited to the free monthly community meal hosted at Our Savior Lutheran Church on the third Sunday of every month from 5:00 - 6:30 PM. There is no meal in December, as well as in June, July, and August.

organization.name: National Call Center for Homeless Veterans
organization.description: Veterans who are homeless or at risk of homelessness—and their family members, friends and supporters—can make the call to or chat online with the National Call Center for Homeless Veterans, where trained counselors are ready to talk confidentially 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

organization.name: Social Security
organization.description: Administers retirement, disability, survivor, and family benefits, and enrolls individuals in Medicare. Also provides Social Security Numbers, which are unique identifiers needed to work, handle financial transactions, and determine eligibility for certain government services.

organization.name: Program for Early Parent Support
organization.description: A nonprofit organization that helps parents connect and grow as they begin their journey into parenthood. Parent support programs educate, inform and create community.

organization.name: Welcome Senior Activity Center
organization.description: Offers a variety of activities and programs to meet the diverse interests of the local senior population. Activities include card games, pool tables, and potluck lunch on Thursdays at 12:00 PM.

organization.name: Generations Forward
organization.description: A collaborative of Whatcom families and community partners that strive to support children and family well-being through relationship building, education and co-learning, and policy advocacy.

organization.name: Seattle Children's
organization.description: Regional children's hospital providing superior patient care, advancing new discoveries and treatments through pediatric research, and serving as the pediatric and adolescent academic medical center for Washington, Alaska, Montana and Idaho – the largest region of any children’s hospital in the country.

organization.name: Whatcom County Pregnancy Clinic
organization.description: Faith-based organization dedicated to educating, equipping, and empowering individuals and families facing an unplanned pregnancy. All services are free. (Does not provide abortion services)

organization.name: Kids in Motion Therapy Clinic
organization.description: Provides physical, occupational and speech therapy for children with neurodevelopmental disorders. Offers both center-based (located at Christ the King Community Church, Bellingham) and home-based therapy services to support the development of successful strategies for daily living.

organization.name: Parenting Academy
organization.description: Parent skill-building programs available, including one-on-one coaching, groups, and parenting seminars for parents, grandparents, families and friends of children.

organization.name: Grief Share
organization.description: Seminars and support groups  led by people who understand grief and want to help.

organization.name: Veterans Crisis Line
organization.description: Provides Veterans, service members, National Guard and Reserve members, and those who support them with access to free, confidential support 24/7, 365 days a year.

organization.name: Mount Baker School District
organization.description: Public school district for Eastern Whatcom County.

organization.name: Bellingham Public Schools
organization.description: Public school district for Bellingham, WA.

organization.name: Whatcom Family and Community Network
organization.description: Promotes the well-being of children, youth, and families by convening and supporting communities to build their capacity. WFCN networks for collective action on issues that matter; to develop community capacity through prevention strategies, such as leadership and skill development and increasing healthy activities to reduce substance abuse and other harmful behavior.

organization.name: Bellingham Technical College
organization.description: A leading educational institution, and the only technical college in northwest Washington State. BTC offers skills-focused education in a supportive, student-first environment.

organization.name: Nooksack Indian Tribe
organization.description: Tribal government comprised of various departments that work to improve the quality of life of Nooksack Tribal members.

organization.name: William Matthews VFW Post 1585
organization.description: Supports programs to increase awareness of the sacrifices of America’s veterans; promote citizenship education, volunteerism and positive youth programs; and facilitate medical, rehabilitative, educational and employment services and needs for veterans and their families.

organization.name: Lake Whatcom Center
organization.description: Licensed not-for-profit organization providing an array of residential and community mental health services to adults with severe and persistent mental illness in Whatcom County and surrounding communities.

organization.name: National Sexual Assault Hotline
organization.description: Call to access a range of free services including confidential support from a trained staff member, support finding a local health facility with services like sexual assault forensic exams, someone to help you talk through what happened, local resources that can assist with your next steps toward healing and recovery, referrals for long term support in your area, information about the laws in your community, and basic information about medical concerns.

organization.name: CostPlus Drug Company
organization.description: Web-based prescription drug company offering generic brand prescription medications at low cost.

organization.name: DSHS (Washington State Department of Social and Health Services)
organization.description: Washington's social services department.

organization.name: The Arc of Whatcom County
organization.description: Works to improve the quality of life, increase the independence and assure the full inclusion in the community of all persons with developmental disabilities. The Arc acts as an information resource, linking persons with developmental disabilities and their families with available resources in the community.

organization.name: Alternative Humane Society
organization.description: An all-volunteer, nonprofit animal welfare organization serving Whatcom County.

organization.name: Habitat for Humanity
organization.description: A non-profit organization committed to eliminating substandard housing through the building of safe, decent, affordable homes with partner families.

organization.name: Stepping Stones Clean and Sober Housing
organization.description: Clean and sober housing for men and women.

organization.name: Mount Baker Planned Parenthood
organization.description: A non-profit family planning organization providing reproductive health care services and sexuality education, and protecting the right to choose. Many patients qualify for free services, and help enrolling in health insurance is available.

Christ the King Community Church Bellingham

service.name: Sun House
service.description: A 9 bedroom emergency shelter serving people who are homeless and have behavioral health issues. Trained staff on-duty 24 hours a day.
service.application_process: Most referrals made through Opportunity Council's Coordinated Entry system. Contact the Community Resource Center for intake.

service.name: Second Time Around Program
service.description: Program designed for new parents to attend with their babies, aged 2-16 weeks old, in a family with one or more older children. Groups come together for 2 hours, once a week, for 12 weeks, with time for sharing parenting highs and lows, to focus on the babies' development, and a discussion topic.
service.fees: Sliding scale, flexible pricing. Call for details.

service.name: In-Home Care - NWRC
service.description: Long-Term Care services in the comfort of your own home. Caregiving services, assistance with activities of daily living, nursing services, assistive technology, and even modifications to your house are aspects of in-home care. If you are needing assistance to live safely in your own home and meet income qualifications, you could be eligible to receive in-home care.
service.fees: NWRC provides access to in-home care under Medicaid. You must apply to DSHS to determine your eligibility to have the costs of care covered by Medicaid. Depending on your income, you may have a co-pay that covers a portion of the cost.

service.name: Alcohol and Drug Information School (ADIS)
service.description: An 8-hour class that covers all drugs and their effects on the mind, including pertinent laws and consequences of drug use.

service.name: Cascade Connections Supported Living
service.description: Supports adults with developmental disabilities to live as independently as possible in their own homes and to thrive in their communities. Supports may include, but are not limited to personal care, financial support, budgeting, bill paying, cooking and cleaning, support making and attending medical appointments, positive behavior supports, and community integration.
service.application_process: Call for more information.

service.name: Supportive Services for Veteran Families
service.description: Provides housing and support services to those who have served in active military, naval or air service, and their families. The program aims to serve those who are at risk of homelessness or who are homeless.
service.application_process: Contact the Community Resource Center for screening.

service.name: IOP Program - LWC
service.description: Intensive Outpatient Program. A home and community-based treatment program for adults experiencing severe and persistent mental health symptoms. IOP offers the opportunity to develop sustainable coping skills, vocational skills, interpersonal skills, and self-awareness of mental health illnesses.
service.application_process: Fill out the Outpatient Services Paperwork available online, return paperwork to Lake Whatcom Center.

service.name: Washington State Department of Licensing
service.description: Renew, replace or apply for a driver license, ID card, or instruction permit; renew vehicle tabs or boat decals; get new license plates; report a vehicle sale or transfer of ownership; register a vehicle or boat; get a disabled parking placard or tabs; and more.

service.name: McKinney-Vento Program - BPS
service.description: Serves students experiencing homelessness. This program is designed to reduce isolation, maximize stability and maintain consistency for this population of children and youth. Contact the liaison in your school district for support.

service.name: Child Forensic Interviews - Dawson Place
service.description: If a forensic interview is requested by law enforcement for a child ages 3 - 17 who is a victim of abuse, you will be interviewed by a Child Interview Specialist.
service.application_process: Call for information

service.name: Unity Care NW Behavioral Health
service.description: Provides behavioral health services integrated with medical care, traditional counseling and psychiatric services, support and wellness groups, and case management services to help you access other community resources such as housing, food, and legal assistance.
service.fees: Apple Health (Medicaid), Medicare, and private insurance accepted. Sliding Fee Discount Program available based on household size and income.

service.name: Everson Senior Center
service.description: Community center for seniors 50+ years of age to come together on Monday mornings to enjoy good company and activities. Activities may include Wii bowling, puzzles, pool, cards, and conversation.

service.name: Ground-Level Response and Coordinated Engagement (GRACE)
service.description: A community-based effort to find solutions for individuals who are high utilizers of emergency and criminal justice systems. The aim is to offer intensive, coordinated services to those whose needs span beyond any single agency. The GRACE Program provides intensive case management, coordination of services, and ongoing support.
service.application_process: Participants join GRACE through community partner referrals.

service.name: St. Vincent de Paul Society
service.description: Provides limited emergency financial assistance through vouchers for food, gas, and other basic needs. Call  and leave a message to request assistance. Messages will be responded to on Tuesday mornings

service.name: WiFi Hotspot Lending - BPL
service.description: If you need access to the Internet, your Library can help by lending you a mobile Wi-Fi hotspot device. If you have a Bellingham or Whatcom County library card, you may borrow a hotspot for 3 weeks. If no one is waiting, it can be renewed up to 3 times. Visit the online catalog to place a request.

service.name: Intervention Services - Contact Counseling
service.description: Support for family members to find the appropriate help for individuals experiencing Chemical Dependency (drug addiction or alcoholism). If you have a loved one, an employee or friend who is struggling with substance abuse, call to set up a consultation.

service.name: Washington 211
service.description: Dial 2-1-1 from anywhere in Washington State to get connected to local services.

service.name: Bellingham Senior Activity Center
service.description: Programs include hiking and walking groups, fitness classes, health services, writing and discussion groups, artistic opportunities, card games, music and dance, recreation, senior community meals, and more.

service.name: Veteran Advocacy
service.description: Veterans with a legal problem related to housing may talk to a lawyer for free. Call for more information.

service.name: PEPS LGBTQIA+ Program
service.description: A peer-support meeting for parents and caregivers who identify as LGBTQIA+, and with children aged 0-12. Groups will meet virtually once a week for 12 weeks.
service.fees: Sliding scale, flexible pricing. Call for details.

service.name: Down Syndrome Outreach Program
service.description: Families needing information and education specifically related to Down syndrome are provided a trained Parent Advocate to address their needs. Families are also connected to other families to develop natural peer support through fun, family-friendly events throughout the year.

service.name: Housing Programs - Clearpoint
service.description: As a HUD-certified agency, Clearpoint offers housing programs that can help with a variety of situations, from buying your first house to helping you retain your home in times of crisis.

service.name: Al-Anon
service.description: A fellowship of people that come together for help because a loved one’s drinking is affecting them. Loved ones can include spouses, siblings, children or grandchildren, parents or grandparents, and friends. Find a meeting close to you using the online search tool.

service.name: Blue Skies Shoe Distribution Program
service.description: The Spring shoe distribution is scheduled for March / May, and Back to School Shoe Give is scheduled for August / September each year. An appointment must be scheduled in order to receive an application.
service.application_process: Call to set an appointment, then an application will be mailed to you.

service.name: Ray of Hope Summer Day Camp
service.description: 5-week summer day program for elementary school-age children who have experienced difficult life circumstances and exhibit emotional and behavioral issues as a result, preventing them from assimilating into more traditional summer camps. Camp includes outdoor recreational and physical fitness-related activities, music and arts enrichment, daily off-site field trips, and small group conversations that encourage and support positive coping skills and self-management.
service.application_process: Check website for application details.

service.name: Medicaid Personal Care Parent Training
service.description: Six hours of continuing education are required to fulfill parental obligations in receiving Medicaid Personal Care funding to care for their family member. Twice a year the Parent Coalition Program conducts trainings tailored to meet the needs of these families. Email admin@arcwhatcom.org for more information.

service.name: Sunrise Behavioral Health Services
service.description: Services include certified behavioral health and chemical dependency treatment, outpatient treatment and medication management, jail transition services, behavioral health case management, individual therapy, and specialty groups.

service.name: Child Find Preschool Screenings - BPS
service.description: A screening to identify any factors that may interfere with a child’s learning, growth and development. The screening is also provided to help parents identify their child’s strengths and weaknesses and provide home suggestions and/or further evaluation if needed in any area of concern. Any child, birth to five, whose family or care givers would like more information about their child’s development can contact their local school district to receive a free Child Find Screening.
service.application_process: Screenings can be completed for any child, birth to age five, whose family or caregiver would like more information about their child’s development. Call, email, or fill out the online form to apply.

service.name: NAMI Basics Class
service.description: 6-week education program for parents and family caregivers of children and teens whom are experiencing symptoms of a mental illness or whom have already been diagnosed.
service.application_process: Register online or call.

service.name: Salvation Army Christmas Assistance
service.description: Holiday assistance programs that provide lower-income families in our community with an opportunity to receive gifts, have gifts for their children, and funds to purchase food for a Christmas dinner celebration.
service.application_process: Enrollment for Christmas assistance typically begins in October each year.

service.name: Washington’s Mental Health Referral Service for Children and Teens
service.description: Connects families with mental health providers who accept new patients, work with your insurance and fit your child’s treatment needs. The Referral Service is accessible to children and teens 17 and under living in Washington state. Teens between the ages of 13 and 17 can also call the Referral Service to find providers for themselves. For interpretation services, call 866-583-1527.
service.application_process: Call or complete an online request

service.name: Blaine Primary Developmental Preschool
service.description: An Integrated Preschool Program that provides Mandated Preschool Services for children who are 3 to 5 years of age who have been identified as having developmental delays and/or disabilities, as well as developmentally appropriate preschool experience for a selected number of typical peers.
service.application_process: Call or email if you have a child age 3 - 5 who you suspect may have a disability concern.
service.fees: Tuition only applies to peer students

service.name: Adult Literacy Program - WLC
service.description: Offers free one-to-one tutoring services for adults who wish to improve their literacy skills. Services include support for basic reading and writing skills, GED (General Educational Development) test preparation, and basic computer skills.

service.name: The EMBERcenter- Peer Support
service.description: One-on-one parenting support with a peer provider of your choice. Schedule sessions via text, phone, or video chat as often as you want. Each session is about 30 minutes. Peer support providers are available in English and Spanish.
service.application_process: Schedule a time to connect with your peer supporter of choice on theEMBERCenter's website.

service.name: Washington Forms Online
service.description: Provides do-it-yourself court forms on a variety of non-criminal legal issues.

service.name: Aging and Long-Term Support Administration
service.description: Provides assistance to seniors and people with disabilities in need of state-funded care services.

service.name: Teacher Resources - BPL
service.description: Bellingham Public Library works collaboratively with local educators to provide useful resources to Bellingham students, including curriculum support materials, and class visits for pre-school through high school students.

service.name: Court Approved Evaluations - Clarity MHR
service.description: A mental health or addictions specialist is available to diagnose DSM5 disorders, make recommendations and referrals for treatment, and prepare court approved documentation.

service.name: Nooksack Tribal Clinic
service.description: An ambulatory clinic that provides on-site, acute and preventive health care to the Nooksack Indian Tribe and eligible members of federally recognized Tribes. Services include family medicine, pediatric, obstetrics and gynecology, family planning, women’s health, diabetes screening and testing, nutrition education, and community health and nurse health care practices.

service.name: Student Loan Counseling - Clearpoint
service.description: A student loan counseling session will give you the opportunity to discuss your options with a counselor who will give personalized recommendations about the repayment programs you might qualify for, along with other suggestions to make the debt more manageable.

service.name: Northwest Behavioral
service.description: Provides counseling services for individuals, couples, and families. Case management services available for qualified Group Health clients in their homes or care facilities. Referrals to other care providers in the community provided when appropriate.
service.application_process: Call or email for information
service.fees: Call for details and to confirm insurance benefits

service.name: Weatherization Program
service.description: Improves a home’s energy efficiency, durability, indoor air quality and addresses health and safety concerns.  Weatherization services focus on attic, floor and wall insulation, reducing drafts, heating system cleaning and safety inspection and ventilation improvements. Available for both homeowners and renters with landlord permission.

service.name: Washington Survivors of Suicide Companion Mentor
service.description: Those who have lost someone to suicide can receive phone-based peer support from someone who has also experienced a suicide loss.
service.application_process: To request a grief companion for yourself or a loved one, fill out the online form

service.name: Kids in Motion Physical Therapy
service.description: Pediatric physical therapists are movement specialists who work with children with a wide range of diagnoses from infancy through adolescence. They help children work towards functioning independently and promote participation in various activities at home, school, and the community.
service.application_process: Call to apply for services. There is a waitlist for services, wait times vary by service type.

service.name: Coaching for Parents with Teens - Parenting Academy
service.description: Meet with a parenting coach to achieve the unique goals you have for you, your teen and family.
service.application_process: Call or apply online
service.fees: Fees apply. Insurance and private payment accepted, scholarships available.

service.name: Loaves and Fishes Community Meal
service.description: Free hot meal served weekly.

service.name: 2SLGBTQ+ Text
service.description: Texting service to provide support for LGBTQ+ Native youth. Text "LGBTQ2S" or "ALLY" to 94449.
service.application_process: Text "LGBTQ2S" or "ALLY" to 94449, or register online.
service.fees: Standard text messaging rates may apply.

service.name: Care Coordination - NWRC
service.description: Assists individuals with serious and complex health care challenges to navigate large health care systems and find the resources they need to meet their health goals.
service.fees: Medicaid pays for Health Homes Care Coordination if you are eligible. Hospital Care Coordinators work with whomever is referred to them by the hospital social workers.

service.name: Grief Support Center Search Tool
service.description: Find a support center or camp near you using the National Alliance for Children's Grief's online search tool.

service.name: Apple Health Diaper Program
service.description: If your child is on Apple Health medical, has special health care needs, and is 3 years or older, you can use the Apple Health Provider One medical to buy diapers from eligible vendors. Limit 200 diapers per month. See link for more details.
service.application_process: Contact an eligible vendor and ask for "intake" to set up an account.

service.name: Whatcom Community College
service.description: Offers transfer degrees, professional-technical training programs, as well as basic education, job skills, and Community & Continuing Education classes.
service.application_process: Apply for admissions online.

service.name: Missing & Unidentified Persons Unit
service.description: Assists law enforcement agencies and parents in locating missing persons. Call the toll-free, 24-hour number to report missing persons. Local law enforcement must be notified before MUPU can become involved.

service.name: Ferndale Resource Center
service.description: Services provided onsite include job search assistance, resume, cover letter, and interview assistance, clothing, housewares, bedding, food, shower passes, bus passes, internet, fax and phone access, and connections to basic need and educational resources in Whatcom County.

service.name: VA Primary Care
service.description: Providers work closely with Veterans to plan for all the care they need to stay healthy and well throughout life, including immunizations and vaccinations.

service.name: Lummi WIC
service.description: WIC is a supplemental food and nutrition/breastfeeding education program that helps pregnant women, new mothers and young children eat well, learn about nutrition and breastfeeding, and stay healthy.

service.name: Developmental Disabilities Administration
service.description: Programs for people with developmental disabilities, including services for personal care, respite, employment, residential supports, and more.

service.name: Skookum Kids Respite
service.description: Respite care allows foster parents to get trusted and trauma informed care for the kids that they care for, while they get some time off.

service.name: Adult Protective Services
service.description: Report concerns involving vulnerable adults online, by phone, fax, or email.

service.name: DVSAS Advocacy Counseling
service.description: Advocacy counseling is available to clients who want to meet one-on-one with an advocacy counselor. Sessions are available on a walk-in or scheduled basis during business hours. These sessions are strength and empowerment-based and include emotional support, on-going safety planning, identifying coping skills, problem solving, information about the effects of domestic violence and sexual assault, and referrals to other community resources.

service.name: Círculo de Alianza Latina para la Maternidad Acompañada
service.description: A peer support group for Spanish speaking mothers. Meets twice a month, both in-person and zoom options available.
service.application_process: Drop in, no registration required.

service.name: Sisu Children's Fund
service.description: Grants for children and young adults with medical problems or physical disabilities to meet needs that are not covered by insurance. Also provides education scholarships to young adults with medical and/or physical disabilities.
service.application_process: Applications available online and must be submitted via mail. Main funding available 4 times a year. Scholarship specific funding available once a year.

service.name: Social Security Survivors Benefits
service.description: Benefits paid to widows, widowers, and dependents of eligible workers. This benefit is particularly important for young families with children. You and your family could be eligible for benefits based on the earnings of a worker who died. The deceased person must have worked long enough to qualify for benefits.
service.application_process: Call to notify Social Security Administration immediately when a person dies.

service.name: Nooksack Tribal Veterans Program
service.description: Services ensure Tribal Veterans receive the benefits they deserve for serving their country.

service.name: CLEAR Hotline
service.alternate_name: Coordinated Legal Education, Advice and Referral
service.description: A toll-free legal hotline for people with low incomes. Services are targeted to problems that affect basic needs such as housing, income, medical care and family safety. Due to limited resources, lawyers and paralegals are not able to assist every caller.

service.name: DVSAS Professional Trainings
service.description: Trainings for local businesses, organizations, and service providers on domestic violence and sexual assault. These trainings are focused on a wide variety of topics, including sexual harassment in the workplace, medical provider trainings, working with victims of violence, and responding to children and teens who have experienced violence.

service.name: Developmental Preschool - FSD
service.description: Provides a developmentally appropriate curriculum for children 3 -  5 years old who have significant developmental delays.
service.application_process: Complete a Child Find Screening to find out if your child qualifies.

service.name: Compass Health Child and Family Outpatient Services
service.description: Counseling and support services to families with children and youth who may have emotional and/or behavioral challenges. Services include individual therapy, family therapy, and group therapy, case management services to coordinate with schools, Children’s Administration, juvenile justice and other systems that are involved with the particular client.
service.application_process: Call outpatient assessment line for a referral.

service.name: PeopleReady Job Placement
service.description: Staffing experts put people to work in a wide variety of industries. Job placements available to help you earn more money, develop new skills and build relationships with potential employers.

service.name: Old Friends Club
service.description: Community-based social respite programs designed to provide reliable, scheduled respite to those caring for a friend or family member living with dementia. A typical five-hour program includes low-impact social time, light physical activities, art and other creative projects, group-oriented games, and lunch, snacks, and light refreshments throughout the day.
service.application_process: Fill out an Initial Inquiry Form online to reserve a spot on the waitlist.
service.wait_time: Limited membership availability, program waitlist applies.
service.fees: Fees apply. Long Term Care Insurance may be accepted.

service.name: McKinney-Vento Program - LNS
service.description: Serves students experiencing homelessness. This program is designed to reduce isolation, maximize stability and maintain consistency for this population of children and youth. Contact the liaison in your school district for support.

service.name: NAMI Connection Recovery Support Group
service.description: A structured recovery support group that offers respect, encouragement, and hope. Free to those living with mental illness, this group promotes connection and understanding while respecting confidentiality.
service.application_process: Register online.

service.name: Jail Health - NWRC
service.description: Provides nursing and other jail health program administrative services in both facilities under contract with Whatcom County Jail and the Work Center. NWRC jail health staff coordinate closely with other medical providers and behavioral health staff to provide quality healthcare.

service.name: Foster Grads Program
service.description: A program that supports expenses related to helping foster youth graduate high school and/or enroll in higher education (dependent on funding availability). This program is open but not limited to those living in traditional foster homes, group homes, residential treatment centers, kinship care, independent living programs, and emergency placement centers. See application for eligible expenses.
service.application_process: Download application online.

service.name: Catholic Housing Services
service.description: Housing programs serve low-income individuals, families, seniors, and persons with special physical and mental needs, offering resident support services in addition to a clean and safe place to live.
service.application_process: Information and questions about the application process, criteria and waiting list should be directed to the individual program director/staff of properties of interest.

service.name: Blue Skies Driver's Education Scholarship
service.description: Scholarship offered to teens ages 15 to 17 who are homeless, low-income, or in foster care. Application, essay, parent/guardian letter of reference, a third party letter of reference, school grades transcript, and access to a car and auto insurance required. Typically, the scholarship grants up to $400 toward driver's education and is limited to a certain number of scholarships available each Spring and Fall. Award is based on both merit and need.​
service.application_process: Download application online.

service.name: Washington Law Help
service.description: Library of free "know your rights" articles, videos, court forms and do-it-yourself packets covering many common legal issues such as family law, eviction/housing, public benefits and money/debt problems.

service.name: Residential Treatment - LWC
service.description: A co-occurring 32-bed facility providing 24/7 clinical support for individuals diagnosed with persistent mental illness and substance use challenges. Provides psychiatric, MAT, and counseling services through an integrated approach facilitated by qualified professionals.
service.application_process: Fill out the Intake Paperwork available online, return paperwork to Lake Whatcom Center.

service.name: Ferndale Holiday Giving Store
service.description: The Holiday Giving Store is set up just like a store, but gifts are free to families that qualify. The store is stocked with a variety of gifts and toys, and warm clothing like pajamas and sweatshirts are available for parents or guardians to choose for each child. Application typically opens in November.
service.application_process: Apply online in November.

service.name: Foothills Food Bank Mobile Food Pantry
service.description: Food bank distribution the first Saturday and third Friday of every month.

service.name: Teen Link
service.description: Teen volunteers are trained to listen to concerns and talk about a variety of issues, including bullying, drug and alcohol concerns, relationships, stress, and depression. Calls and chats are confidential.

service.name: Help Pay for Child Care
service.description: View online resources or call the Family Center for help finding the right program to help your family pay for child care.

service.name: Medication Assisted Recovery (MAR) - Lifeline Connections
service.description: Provides support for those in need of help overcoming a reliance on prescription pain medication, heroin, or alcohol.

service.name: Housing Counseling - Kulshan Community Land Trust
service.description: Housing and Urban Development (HUD)-Approved Housing Counseling Agency. Offers free pre-purchase homebuyer education and financial counseling to anyone in the community.
service.application_process: Fill out an intake form, fill out a budget and submit additional documentation. Call or email to begin intake process.

service.name: Sensational Toddlers
service.description: A parent-child program for children ages 18 months to 3 years, with and without special needs. Check online for registration openings.

service.name: Psych Med Management - Clarity MHR
service.description: Help with psychiatric medication management for a variety of psychiatric conditions.

service.name: Rights Investigation and Accountability
service.description: Investigates the extent to which individuals with disabilities retain their basic rights to make personal and financial decisions and how people in positions to assist them in exercising those rights respect, protect, and facilitate the individual’s expressed interests.

service.name: Lifeline
service.description: A federal program dedicated to making phone and internet service more affordable for low-income households. This benefit provides eligible consumers with a monthly discount of up to $9.25, or up to $34.25 per month for households living on on qualifying Tribal land. Certain Lifeline providers offer free phone service for qualifying households, and may provide you with a free phone.
service.application_process: Apply online, by mail, or through a phone or internet company.

service.name: Safe Medication Return
service.description: Washington’s Safe Medication Return lets people dispose of household over-the-counter, and prescription medications (including medications for household pets). Visit the website or call the hotline for information on how to safely dispose of medication.

service.name: Child Find Screenings - MBSD
service.description: A screening to identify any factors that may interfere with a child’s learning, growth and development. The screening is also provided to help parents identify their child’s strengths and weaknesses and provide home suggestions and/or further evaluation if needed in any area of concern. Any child, birth to five, whose family or care givers would like more information about their child’s development can contact their local school district to receive a free Child Find Screening.

service.name: Max Higbee Weekend Program
service.description: An opportunity for members to have a fun weekend with friends while having a night on the town. Activities include Art Walk, evening strolls, in-house games and activities, and a fun place to hang out with friends.

service.name: Our Treehouse Family Night
service.description: A supportive environment for children and adults to process their grief. Each child is able to work through their grief at their own pace, engaging with the various “play stations” as they see fit, while their parent or caregiver has the option of meeting with their own support group.
service.application_process: Contact to apply.

service.name: Violence Against Women Act (VAWA) Unit
service.description: Provides direct representation to immigrant survivors of violence seeking immigration benefits. While the VAWA Unit handles several hundred immigration cases per year, the demand for assistance continues to be greater than the available resources meaning there is a long waitlist for clients seeking help.

service.name: Arne Hanna Aquatic Center
service.description: Offerings include lap swims, American Red Cross swim lessons and training courses, shallow water aerobics, deep water running, as well as preschool swims and open swims for people to play and enjoy the facility.
service.fees: Day passes, 10 visit passes, 3 month passes, and annual passes available for a fee.

service.name: Text 4 Sex Ed
service.description: Sex education tips and resources for Native youth. Get everything you need to know about sex and relationships delivered privately to your phone.
service.application_process: Register online to subscribe.
service.fees: Standard text messaging rates may apply.

service.name: PeaceHealth Women's Health
service.description: The women’s health specialists at PeaceHealth help manage the body’s changing needs through all of life’s stages. Team members may include gynecologists, obstetricians, nurse practitioners, certified mid-wives, pelvic floor specialists or gynecologic surgeons. Conditions treated include benign (noncancerous) gynecologic conditions, bladder or bowel leakage, gynecological cancer, and pelvic problems.

service.name: Prevention Coalitions
service.description: The Whatcom County Health Department partners with community organizations and all seven Whatcom County school districts to coordinate and support prevention coalitions and community groups. These coalitions work with schools and others to increase connections and support healthy youth and families. Visit the website to learn more and get involved.

service.name: Dementia Support NW Training, Education, and Outreach
service.description: Adaptable trainings, educational presentations, and informational outreach for communities and the groups that live and work within them. Contact DSNW for more information.

service.name: Pet Licensing - WHS
service.description: License up to three pets using the online form.

service.name: Bayside Therapy Counseling
service.description: Therapy services for individual adults, children and adolescents, couples, families and groups.
service.application_process: Visit the website or call for details.

service.name: PeaceHealth Emergency Medicine
service.description: Around-the-clock care for serious illnesses and injuries. Conditions treated include behavioral health emergencies, brain & spine trauma, cerebrovascular emergencies, heart emergencies, orthopedic injuries, overdoses or poisonings, pregnancy complications, respiratory emergencies, and traumatic injuries.

service.name: WCLS Printing Services
service.description: Call your local branch to arrange document printing and pick up, or submit a request online. Library patrons are provided a $7.00 printing credit each week. Beyond that, printing fees are $0.10 (black & white) or $0.50 (color) per page.

service.name: Basic Food (SNAP)
service.description: The Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program, or SNAP, called Basic Food in Washington, helps people with low incomes make ends meet by providing monthly benefits to buy food. Apply online at washingtonconnection.org, by phone, or at your local Community Services Office.
service.application_process: You can apply for Basic Food Assistance online at washingtonconnection.org, by phone, or at your local Community Services Office.

service.name: Immigration 101 Training for Service Providers
service.description: Training for service providers who may serve the immigrant community as part of their work. These sessions answer questions that community members may have about the immigration system, immigration enforcement, and how immigration issues affect the communities they serve. Training includes an overview of the immigration system and immigration status as well as which resources are available in the community.

service.name: Love INC
service.description: There are two primary ways to receive help: request volunteers to help with simple work, or submit a request for help/financial assistance which will be shared with church partners. There are no guarantees for assistance, and it can take some time (often 3-8 weeks) to arrange. Fill out the "Get Help" form online to request assistance.
service.application_process: Fill out the "Get Help" form online to request assistance.

service.name: Advocacy and Legal Services - WA Autism Alliance
service.description: Provides a range of advocacy services to help adults, youth, and children with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) and other developmental disabilities gain access to health and educational services and supports. These services include family resource and insurance navigation, and legal advocacy on issues related to access to healthcare and education.
service.application_process: Must become a Washington Autism Alliance member to access services. Membership is free and can be completed online.

service.name: Mental Health Assessments - Dawson Place
service.description: Mental health assessments are provided to all child victims of abuse.
service.application_process: Call for details

service.name: Whatcom Mental Health Newsletter
service.description: Relevant local mental health related information gathered from the community and shared through a periodic electronic newsletter.

service.name: Blaine Food Bank
service.description: Provides food to Blaine, Custer, Birch Bay, and Semiahmoo residents. Fresh fruits and vegetables, dairy, protein, and bakery items offered in an "outdoor undercover farmers market" setting.

service.name: Parent/Teen Mediation
service.description: A 2-3 hour long mediation process for parents/guardians and teens to resolve conflicts.
service.application_process: Call to speak with a case manager

service.name: NWAF Financial Coaching
service.description: Free one-on-one financial coaching for people with disabilities in Washington and Oregon. Topics include credit, savings, debt, budgeting, banking, identity protection, benefits, and assistive technology.
service.interpretation_services: Telephone-Based Interpreter Services, Sign Language (in-person or video)

service.name: Single Entry Access to Services
service.description: Housed at the Opportunity Council, this program provides resources and support for families and medical professionals looking for services for children birth to 21 in Whatcom County with known or suspected special health care needs.

service.name: Washington Recovery Help Line
service.description: Anonymous and confidential help line that provides crisis intervention and referral services for Washington State residents. Professionally trained volunteers and staﬀ are available to provide emotional support 24 hours a day, and oﬀer local treatment resources for substance abuse, problem gambling and mental health as well as to other community services.

service.name: Dementia Support Program - NWRC
service.description: Help for people with dementia and their caregivers. Can provide support and make referrals to individuals experiencing dementia including for memory screening, medical diagnosis, and support groups; support to caregivers of people with dementia of all levels, including consultation, options counseling, care planning, and appropriate referrals; dementia education; legal resources; social opportunities; and more.

service.name: Lynden Community / Senior Center
service.description: Services include meal program, wellness programs, exercise and rehabilitation opportunities, recreational center, educational center, entertainment, social space, and information and assistance.

service.name: Victim Support Services
service.description: Criminal justice system advocacy, resources, referrals, educational and support groups for victims of crime and their families. Services are free of charge.  Please note that VSS is located in Washington State and serves Snohomish county with limited services in other WA counties (King, Island, Skagit and Whatcom) on a case-by-case basis.
service.application_process: Call phone number and press 1 to be connected to the Referral Line to be assigned an advocate. Responses may take up to 48-hours during business hours only.

service.name: Summer Day Camp - ANT
service.description: Summer camp for youth ages 6-18. Get to know horses, create fun art projects, play with cute farm animals, meet new friends, develop valuable life skills, and more. Day Camp is not a horseback riding camp – while there is some riding involved, it is only a part of what is done while at camp.
service.application_process: Registration is first-come, first- served and is limited to one week per child/family. Complete a participant registration form available online, and return by mail or email to program@animalsasnaturaltherapy.org.
service.fees: Fees apply. Partial scholarships are available based on a sliding fee scale. Proof of income and Financial Aid Application is required.

service.name: Substance Use Disorder Counseling - Clarity MHR
service.description:
Individual, couples, and family counseling available. Individual counseling sessions are designed to address a client’s specific recovery and/or mental health needs. Sessions may focus on trauma, sadness, grief, stress, loneliness and other factors leading to a cycle of addiction. Each patient is encouraged to have some couples or family counseling as well. 

Family therapy can be done with or without the primary client present.

service.name: Lynden Inclusive Preschool
service.description: Serves children ages 3 through 5 who have a disability as well as students who do not have a disability (peer models).  Students who qualify for Special Education services are enrolled and served as they turn 3 years of age. Children who do not qualify for Special Education services but who are ages 3 to 5 may apply to be enrolled.
service.application_process: Wait list opens the first school day in the January prior to the desired school year
service.fees: Tuition only applies for children who do not qualify for Special Education services

service.name: Medicare Part D (Drug Coverage)
service.description: Helps cover the cost of prescription drugs. You can join a Medicare drug plan in addition to Original Medicare (Parts A and B), or you get it by joining a Medicare Advantage Plan with drug coverage (Part C). Plans that offer Medicare drug coverage are run by private insurance companies that follow rules set by Medicare.

service.name: PEPS Working Moms Program
service.description: Virtual gathering series open to mothers, adoptive mothers, and non-gestational mothers with children aged 0-5 years, working outside of the home. 8-week series of 1.5 hour meetings held on weekday evenings or weekday lunchtimes.

service.name: Ben's Fund
service.description: Provides funds to families in need to help cover costs associated with medical bills, therapies and numerous other aspects of supporting a child or young adult on the autism spectrum. Applicants request a yearly grant to help cover the costs to get the care, support and items needed.
service.application_process: Apply by mail. Once an application is received, applicants will be notified within 14 days that it is either complete, or incomplete indicating what documents are missing. Application decision process may take up to 45 days.

service.name: Debt Management Program (DMP) - Clearpoint
service.description: A Debt Management Program is a structured repayment plan that helps you pay off your unsecured debts more easily. Often, it comes with the added benefits of lower interest rates and waived fees.

service.name: Self-Advocacy Program
service.description: A program for young adults ages 16 to 30 with developmental disabilities. Self advocacy members are encouraged to develop and practice skills to become strong self-advocates.

service.name: Parent to Parent Support Programs
service.description: Provides emotional support and information to families of children with developmental disabilities, delays, and ongoing health care needs

service.name: Animal Control and Rescue Services - WHS
service.description: 24-hour services include picking up stray, injured, aggressive, dangerous and dead animals; transportation and impoundment of stray animals to the shelter for impound, or in cases of emergency, to a veterinarian for medical treatment; and more. If you are aware of an animal being abused or neglected, please call the Animal Control Office.

service.name: WDRC Trainings
service.description: A variety of dispute resolution trainings are available, including Mediation Trainings (Professional, Family, and Parent-Teen offerings), Parent Education Trainings, Conflict Resolution Trainings, and Exploring Equity and Cultural Humility.

service.name: Child and Adolescent Counseling - TouchStone
service.description: Counseling for drug and alcohol abuse, low self-esteem, bullying, eating disorders, uncontrolled anger, self-injury or suicidal ideation, academic underachievement, and family issues.
service.fees: All insurance providers accepted, sliding scale available if no insurance.

service.name: Crisis Helpline- The Trevor Project
service.description: LGBTQ young people can talk with a trained counselor for free, confidential and secure 24/7 service when they are struggling with issues such as coming out, LGBTQ identity, depression, and suicide.

service.name: Whatcom County Pregnancy Clinic
service.description: Faith-based organization with free services including pregnancy tests, limited ultrasound, options education, STI testing, parenting and childbirth education, and support groups. (Does not provide abortion services)

service.name: Domestic Violence Intervention Treatment (DVIT)
service.description: WA State certified DVIT provider. Intimate partner violence is addressed through programs that are mandated by the court, but provide a safe and nurturing place to grow and learn. Services include Domestic Violence Assessments, support group, and individual counseling.

service.name: Nooksack Education Department
service.description: Provides quality educational opportunities from early childhood through life, in accordance with the Tribe’s need for cultural and economic well-being in keeping with the wide diversity of the Tribe as distinct cultural and governmental entities. Services include education grants, student support for struggling students, and a Tribal Education Liaison to assist Nooksack families communicate with local school districts.

service.name: HireQuest
service.description: Temporary workforce hiring and professional recruiting solutions.  Industries include construction, light industrial, healthcare, hospitality, CDL/non-CDL, disaster restoration, and more.

service.name: Asylum Unit - NWIRP
service.description: Defends the rights of people who have a fear of persecution in their home country and help them gain safety through asylum. Also assists 'pro se' applicants with navigating the asylum application process, and works with outside agencies, communities, and organizations to promote the rights and dignity of and offer support services to persons fleeing persecution in their home countries.

service.name: Poison Center Hotline
service.description: Immediate, free and expert treatment advice and assistance provided by phone 24/7/365.

service.name: McKinney-Vento Program - MBSD
service.description: Serves students experiencing homelessness. This program is designed to reduce isolation, maximize stability and maintain consistency for this population of children and youth. Contact the liaison in your school district for support.

service.name: Family Companions Program
service.description: Family Companions offer support to parents during a time of need. A Family Companion is a volunteer who wants to share an unconditional relationship with a parent in their community.
service.application_process: Call or email for details, or online referral form available.

service.name: Manpower Job Placement
service.description: Provides job seekers access to jobs, personal guidance, and career development including assessments, training, and education programs.

service.name: NAMI Family Support Group
service.description: Support group for family members, parents, caregivers, and friends of individuals struggling with mental illness.
service.application_process: Register online.

service.name: Library Cards - BPL
service.description: Apply online or in person to receive a free library card. Adult applicants will ned to provide a photo ID.
service.application_process: Apply online or in person.

service.name: TrevorSpace
service.description: An affirming, online community for LGBTQ young people between the ages of 13-24 years old. With over 400,000 members across the globe, you can explore your identity, get advice, find support, and make friends in a moderated community intentionally designed for you.

service.name: Whatcom Long Term Recovery Group
service.description: Provides coordination and recovery services to individuals, families and entities adversely impacted by disaster in Whatcom County.

service.name: Child Find Screenings - NVSD
service.description: A screening to identify any factors that may interfere with a child’s learning, growth and development. The screening is also provided to help parents identify their child’s strengths and weaknesses and provide home suggestions and/or further evaluation if needed in any area of concern. Any child, birth to five, whose family or care givers would like more information about their child’s development can contact their local school district to receive a free Child Find Screening.

service.name: Making SMILIES Learning Pathways Class
service.description: Children of adult learners grow in their reading, writing and math skills while attending the Making SMILIES Learning Pathways class.
service.application_process: Download an application online. Return by email, or mail to AWGFLC PO Box 218, Everson, WA 98247.

service.name: Tech Help - BPL
service.description: Need help with technology questions or with using the Library’s electronic resources? Help is available by phone, by email, in person, or with one-on-one assistance during a Tech Basics Coaching session. Coaching sessions take place every Wednesday afternoon at the Central Library. Check the event calendar for upcoming sessions, and call to register.

service.name: Family Advocacy Support
service.description: Rebound acts as a collaborative bridge between state agencies, schools, community-based services, the legal system, and churches. The Family Advocacy Support program strengthens connections with each family participating in programs by providing a single access point between Rebound and other social services. Services include one-on-one mentorship, referrals to additional services, and help for families to network with other families struggling with similar challenges.
service.application_process: Contact for more information.

service.name: 1-800-Runaway Hotline
service.description: By calling 1-800-RUNAWAY, you can connect with a trusted, compassionate person who will listen and help you create a plan to address your concerns. Live Chat online and email also available.

service.name: Sea Mar Migrant and Seasonal Farmworker Promotores Program
service.description: Provides linguistically and culturally appropriate health care services and health information to the farmworker community. During high migrant season, services include mobile medical and dental clinics at farms, farmworker camps and housing sites, and summer health fairs. During off-peak season, services include culturally-appropriate workshops, and presentations and events to farms, housing sites and gathering spaces on critical health topics.

service.name: Blaine Food Bank Home Delivery Program
service.description: Home delivery provided once a week for anyone who needs food but is unable to visit the Blaine Food Bank in person. Call or email for more information.
service.application_process: Contact Blaine Food Bank for more information.

service.name: InfantSEE Assessment
service.description: A public health program designed to ensure that eye and vision care becomes an integral part of infant wellness care to improve a child's quality of life. Under this program, no-cost comprehensive eye and vision assessments are available for infants 6-12 months old regardless of a family's income or access to insurance coverage.
service.application_process: Use the doctor locator online to find a provider near you, then contact the provider to schedule an assessment.

service.name: Sunrise Recovery Services
service.description: Services include individualized treatment plans, DUI and chemical dependency assessments, outpatient services, intensive outpatient services, alcohol and drug information school, individual and group therapy, help with family and personal conflicts, and connection with legal, employment, and family services.

service.name: Ask an Advocate at DVSAS
service.description: Confidentially ask for support online. The Ask an Advocate page is monitored Monday-Friday, 9am - 5pm. You should receive a message back within 24-hours. If you need to speak with someone immediately, please call the helpline.

service.name: Welcome Senior Activity Center
service.description: Offers a variety of activities and programs to meet the diverse interests of the local senior population. Activities include card games, pool tables, and potluck lunch on Thursdays at 12:00 PM.

service.name: Landlord-Tenant Mediation
service.description: Mediation, conflict coaching, and phone conciliation services for landlords and tenants who wish to resolve disputes, improve communication, increase understanding, successfully negotiate payment or re-payment plans, discuss deposits and move out timelines, address lease agreements and other related issues, and move forward with creative solutions determined by the parties.

service.name: Blaine Food Bank Weekend Backpack Program
service.description: In an effort to ensure that all children have access to food during the weekend the Blaine Food Bank is proud to partner with Wild Bird Charity and the Blaine School District to provide the food for three meals a day, as well as snacks, each weekend for children in the Blaine community who face hunger. Call or email for more information.

service.name: HSDC Interpreting Services
service.description: Provides interpreting for the deaf and hard of hearing, for all events, occasions, and engagements. Interpreting services include American Sign Language (ASL), Signed English (PSE) transliteration, Signed Exact English (SEE), tactile and close visual interpretation for deafblind individuals, oral translation for deaf or hard of hearing individuals who rely on speechreading, and Lip-Reading Translation (LRT) for individuals who are unable to express themselves vocally due to tracheotomy or other physical disability.
service.application_process: Request an interpreter online.

service.name: Max Higbee Weekday Program
service.description: Members engage in a variety of activities and community excursions. Programs include YMCA workouts, cooking classes, hikes, sports, library visits, art projects and much more. Alternative activities are always provided.

service.name: Drug and Alcohol Counseling - Contact Counseling
service.description: Provides a variety of substance use disorder services. These include drug and alcohol use assessments, intervention, consultation and addiction treatment referral services.

service.name: Freedge Food Pantry
service.description: A community refrigerator packed with free nutritious food that breaks down barriers to food access. Expect to find the Freedge packed Tuesday – Saturday with individual portions of surplus food from local restaurants, garden produce, and shelf stable pantry items. The freedge is located behind the RE Store near the RE Patch Community Garden.

service.name: Operation School Bell
service.description: Provides new school clothing and shoes to students in need in K through 12 grades. Referrals made through Whatcom County School Districts in the fall. Teen Team program, operating under Operation School Bell, is a voucher program for homeless high school students identified by the homeless high school coordinators.
service.application_process: Referrals are made through school district staff in the Fall. Contact your district for more information.

service.name: Unity Care NW Children's Medical Care
service.description: Coordinated primary medical and dental care for children and adolescents, including well-child visits, newborn care, developmental screenings, immunizations, sports exams, and specialty referrals.
service.fees: Apple Health (Medicaid), Medicare, and private insurance accepted. Sliding Fee Discount Program available based on household size and income.

service.name: Native Crisis Text Line
service.description: 24/7 crisis text line for Native youth. If you need advice from a trained counselor, text “NATIVE” to 741741.
service.fees: Standard text messaging rates may apply.

service.name: Youth Restorative Practices Program
service.description: Empowers youth to approach conflict in healthy and creative ways through a restorative justice approach.
service.application_process: Online application available

service.name: Connecting the Expecting Program
service.description: This program is designed for families in their third trimester of pregnancy, or who are planning to adopt a baby within the next few months. Local expectant and adoptive parents can attend this 6-week, 1.5 hours weekly online program, solo or with a partner. It is recommended for families to register for a group that best aligns with their baby's due date.
service.fees: Sliding scale, flexible pricing. Call for details.

service.name: Miracle Food Network
service.description: Community-based food distributor with locations throughout Whatcom County. Food pick-up days/times vary by location. Schedule and phone numbers for each location are listed online.
service.application_process: Call ahead to schedule food pick-up. Locations and phone numbers available online.

service.name: ESL/ELL Classes - A Watered Garden
service.description: Non-native English speakers are empowered with tools they can use as members of a growing community through classes for adults in ESL/ELL and Certified Education in Spanish.
service.application_process: Download an application online. Return by email, or mail to AWGFLC PO Box 218, Everson, WA 98247.

service.name: Medicare Advantage (Part C)
service.description: A Medicare-approved plan from a private company that offers an alternative to Original Medicare for your health and drug coverage. These “bundled” plans include Part A, Part B, and usually Part D. Plans may have lower out-of-pocket costs than Original Medicare, and may offer some extra benefits that Original Medicare doesn’t cover, like vision, hearing, and dental services.

service.name: Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF)
service.description: Provides temporary cash assistance for families in need. Some families participate in the WorkFirst Program. The WorkFirst Program helps participants find and keep jobs.
service.application_process: You can apply for TANF online at washingtonconnection.org, by phone, or at your local Community Services Office.

service.name: WTA Zone Service
service.description: Provides limited transit service to rural areas of Whatcom County. There are no eligibility requirements for using zone service; anyone within the designated area can request a ride. Service is only available to each zone on certain days of the week. Advance reservations are required.
service.application_process: Reservations are required no later than 5:00 PM the day before you ride. Since seating is limited, calling a day (or up to a week) in advance is recommended.

service.name: Ferndale Student Services
service.description: Serves Special Education, English Language Learners, Native American Education, Section 504, Early Learning and McKinney Vento (Homeless families and youth), students in Foster Care and Migrant students, student health needs and families and students in need of resources (clothing, food, transportation, etc.).

service.name: Whatcom Volunteer Center
service.description: Transforms people and neighborhoods by providing a means for volunteers, nonprofits, schools, government and health care organizations to come together to solve community challenges.

service.name: GED Class - A Watered Garden
service.description: General Education Diploma graduates will find themselves better qualified for employment advancements.
service.application_process: Download an application online. Return by email, or mail to AWGFLC PO Box 218, Everson, WA 98247.

service.name: Conservation Education
service.description: Provides both in-home energy assessments and classroom-based workshops to identify ways to save on energy bills, conserve energy and water, improve health and safety in homes. This services is no cost to eligible households.

service.name: Habitat for Humanity Housing Help
service.description: A unique opportunity for hardworking families to help build and buy their own homes. Eligibility based on length of Whatcom residency, income, current housing status, ability to make timely monthly mortgage payments, and background check.
service.application_process: Complete a Primary Eligibility Interest Form

service.name: Crisis Triage and Stabilization
service.description: The Whatcom County Triage Center (WCTC) in Bellingham can accommodate 5 individuals who are recovering from a mental health crisis. Services include crisis stabilization, walk-in emergency, and next day appointments. Referrals can be made by calling the Crisis Care Line at 800-584-3578. Professionals can call directly to make referrals at 360-676-2020.
service.application_process: Call the Crisis Care Line at 800-584-3578.

service.name: Syringe Services Program
service.description: Diseases like HIV or hepatitis C can be spread when people who use injection drugs share needles or other equipment. Syringe clinics provide new, sterile needles and equipment to people who use injection drugs, and provide connections to drug treatment, disease testing, vaccines, and other social services.

service.name: Earn While You Learn
service.description: At each weekly appointment, clients meet one-on-one with a trained peer mentor for one hour. With each lesson that is completed, clients earn “baby bucks” for supplies such as diapers, wipes, clothing, blankets, and much more.
service.application_process: Apply online

service.name: Maternity Support Services and Infant Case Management (Answers Counseling)
service.description:
Pregnant individuals and parents of infants who have Apple Health/ Medicaid health insurance are eligible to receive: assistance applying for SNAP/ Basic Food benefits, Childcare Subsidy, and PFML benefits; 
nutritionist advice; help accessing medical and behavioral health care; and monthly gift cards for participating in Culturally Responsive Integrated & Strength-Based Parenting (CRISP) classes.

service.name: NeedyMeds
service.description: An online resource with information on programs that provide assistance to people who are unable to afford their medications and health care costs. All information is free, easy to access and updated regularly.

service.name: Child Protective Services
service.description: A state agency that investigates reports of child abuse and neglect.

service.name: Aging and Disability Resources - NWRC
service.description: Information, referrals, and assistance in obtaining services that support independence, dignity, and health of older adults and people with disabilities. Staff can assist with services including in-home care, Medicaid long term care coverage, caregiver support, long-term care options, and other general resources.

service.name: WorkSource Whatcom
service.description: Provides job search support, career exploration, computer use, training on resumes and cover letters, and interview preparation. Job training programs for youth, adults, and mature workers, as well as worker retraining.
service.application_process: Email, call or drop-in for services.

service.name: Paratransit
service.description: Provides curb-to-curb (and if needed, door-to-door) transportation to riders whose disability prevents them from riding fixed route bus system. ​Everyone who rides paratransit must qualify and be approved before riding. Read about paratransit eligibility online.
service.application_process: Download application online.

service.name: Medicare Part A (Hospital Insurance)
service.description: Helps cover inpatient care in hospitals, skilled nursing facility care, hospice care, and home health care. (Included in Original Medicare)

service.name: WCLS Community Resources
service.description: An online database of community resources to help in the event of emergencies and other difficult situations.

service.name: Crisis Online Chat - The Trevor Project
service.description: LGBTQ young people can chat with a trained counselor for free, confidential and secure 24/7 service when they are struggling with issues such as coming out, LGBTQ identity, depression, and suicide.

service.name: Foothills Food Bank
service.description: Provides fresh and frozen produce, dairy products, meat, proteins, canned and dry goods, and bread. When available, items like baby food, vitamins, hygiene items, and vegetable starts also provided. Please bring your own bags or boxes. Pre-packed box delivery available for homebound individuals.

service.name: Substance Use Disorder (SUD) Services - Lifeline Connections
service.description: Inpatient treatment programs, as well as outpatient treatment programs designed to be as flexible as possible, allowing you to maintain your obligations while still seeking treatment.

service.name: Mending Babyloss Support Group
service.description: Support group where parents can work through their grief in an atmosphere of understanding and compassion. The non-denominational Support Group meets for eight consecutive weeks and includes a social worker, spiritual guidance counselor, and an interfaith minister.
service.application_process: Fill out registration form on website and email.

service.name: Tenant Clinic
service.description: Free legal advice for low-income renters in Whatcom County. If you are worried about being evicted or have any questions regarding your rights as a tenant, call to see if you qualify and set an appointment. The Tenant Clinic is offered virtually by appointment, and once per month in person at Street Law.

service.name: Youth Conflict Resolution Education
service.description: Free and low cost workshops for youth (4th-12th grade) to gain skills in conflict resolution.
service.application_process: Online application available

service.name: Pet Adoption - WHS
service.description: Interactive adoption process strives to place animals into permanent, responsible and loving homes. Prior to meeting an animal, potential adopters are asked to complete an adoption application to better help WHS staff understand what you are looking for in a companion animal.
service.application_process: Application forms for specific animals can be submitted online or may be downloaded.

service.name: Foothills Food Bank Home Delivery
service.description: Homebound families and seniors can receive a pre-packed box or bag from the food bank every week delivered directly to their home. Contact the Foothills Food Bank to set up delivery.
service.application_process: Contact the Foothills Food Bank to set up delivery.

service.name: Parent-Child Interaction Therapy - Parenting Academy
service.description: An intensive treatment program that works with parents and children together to improve the quality of the parent-child relationship and to teach parents the skills necessary to manage their child's severe behavior problems. Appropriate for children ages 2 to 7 with behavioral concerns.
service.application_process: Call or apply online
service.fees: Fees apply. Insurance and private payment accepted.

service.name: The Arc Legislative Advocacy
service.description: Advocacy opportunities that aim to ensure the needs of persons with developmental disabilities are met with appropriate health and social services.

service.name: Job Readiness Lab - Goodwill
service.description: A computer lab open at specific times for community members and Goodwill students to search for jobs, do homework, and practice computer skills.

service.name: Home Repair and Modification Assistance - WHRC
service.description: If you are struggling to afford necessary home repairs or need help making modifications to your home due to changing mobility and ability needs related to aging, injury, or emerging disability, call the WHRC Hotline for help determining if there is a program in your area that would be a match for your needs.

service.name: Lifeline Connections Family Therapy
service.description: A clinician works with you and your family (significant other and/or children) to promote healthy relationships, improve communication and improve the overall well-being of all individuals in the family.
service.application_process: Call or email the Lifeline Connections Admissions office. Online form available.

service.name: Sean Humphrey House
service.description: Provides residence, meals, medication management services, medical supervision, recreational activities and other supportive services to persons living with HIV/AIDS and who also may suffer from other diseases, mental illness, substance abuse, and/or developmental disabilities. To qualify for residency must have low or no income, diagnosis of HIV/AIDS, and be unable to live independently.
service.application_process: Fill out the online contact form or call to request information.

service.name: NAMI Peer-to-Peer Class
service.description: This class is an experiential learning program for people experiencing a mental health challenge who are interested in establishing and maintaining their wellness and recovery. Peer-to-Peer consists of eight two-hour units and is taught by a team of two trained teachers and a volunteer support person, all of whom are personally experienced at living well with mental illness.
service.application_process: Register online or call.

service.name: Washington Autism Alliance Resource Directory
service.description: Directory of resources for people with autism spectrum disorder and related intellectual and developmental disabilities in Washington State.
service.application_process: Register as a member

service.name: Little Wonders Program
service.description: Program open to solo parents and caregivers, couples, and co-parents caring for children with developmental delays and disabilities, with kids aged 0-3 years old. This pilot peer-support program is offered as an 8-week series, and meets virtually.

service.name: Lummi Food Bank
service.description: Commodity food program for income eligible Native Americans and non-tribal people who live on the reservation.

service.name: Assistance for Victims of Scams or Fraud
service.description: If you are a victim of a scam or have been taken advantage of by a lender, call CLEAR to talk to an attorney who will screen you for eligibility, may be able to offer you initial legal advice, and may refer you to LAW Advocates for assistance from a volunteer attorney.

service.name: Maple Alley Inn
service.description: Prepares and serves hot, home cooked meals for the community. Currently providing lunch every Wednesday and Thursday at Faith Lutheran Church.

service.name: Washington Talking Book and Braille Library
