service.description: Provides library services state-wide, at the library and by mail, to any Washington resident unable to read standard print material due to blindness, visual impairment, deaf-blindness, physical disability (cannot hold a book or turn pages), or reading disability.

service.name: Employment Services - LWC
service.description: Helps individuals diagnosed with severe mental illness meet their personal vocational goals. Employment Services assess vocational interests and provide job development, career exploration, resume assistance, and interview preparation using an evidence-based supported employment model to further client development.

service.name: Housing and Essential Needs (HEN)
service.description: Provides access to essential needs items and potential rental assistance for low-income individuals who are unable to work for at least 90 days due to a physical and/or mental incapacity.
service.application_process: You can apply for Cash Assistance online at washingtonconnection.org, by phone, or at your local Community Services Office.

service.name: Whatcom Kid Insider
service.description: Online directory of family-friendly things to do with kids in Whatcom County. Categories include indoor activities, outdoor activities, sports and swim, schools, camps, classes, and more.

service.name: Therapy - LWC
service.description: Individual and group therapy provided by trained and qualified clinicians. Mental health-related assessments and referrals available, as well as case consultation and coordination with in-house and community providers to facilitate optimum client care.

service.name: Trevor Project Resource Center
service.description: Online resource center for LGBTQ young people. Get answers about everything LGBTQ including sexual orientation, mental health, gender identity, community, talking about suicide, and more.

service.name: Head Start
service.description: With no cost for families that qualify, Opportunity Council offers preschool services throughout Whatcom County for children between the ages of 3 and 5.
service.application_process: Apply online, or request an application in person. You can apply any time of the year. While the majority of children begin at the start of the traditional school year, whenever vacancies are available they are filled by families that have completed the eligibility process.

service.name: Blaine and Birch Bay Community Toy Store
service.description:
A holiday gift assistance program for families living in the Blaine School District who are facing difficult financial circumstances. Gifts are arranged in a store-like setting where parents can purchase brand new, unwrapped toys marked down about 75%. Voucher assistance is available for families needing extra help. 
Registration typically takes place in November.
service.application_process: Check for registration information online. Registration typically takes place in November.

service.name: Dolly Parton's Imagination Library
service.description: Sends an age-appropriate book each month to all registered children in Whatcom County. All Whatcom County children aged zero to five are eligible for this free program.
service.application_process: Register online or submit an official registration form filled out by a parent or guardian.

service.name: Nooksack WIC Program
service.description: WIC is a supplemental food and nutrition/breastfeeding education program that helps pregnant women, new mothers and young children eat well, learn about nutrition and breastfeeding, and stay healthy.

service.name: Narcotics Anonymous (NA)
service.description: A non-profit fellowship of people who suffer from the disease of addiction. Groups meet on a regular basis to help each other stay clean and share experience, strength, and hope.

service.name: Project Lifesaver
service.description: An electronic technology program that can locate missing persons using a unique frequency associated with a particular individual. Enrollment in Project Lifesaver includes equipment maintenance, battery changes, and upfront equipment costs. This program is for anyone who might have a tendency to wander, but who might not have the ability to find their way home again including people with dementia, autism, Down's syndrome, and traumatic brain injuries.
service.application_process: Call for more information.

service.name: Camp Mariposa
service.description: A year-round substance use prevention and mentoring program that meets bi-monthly on weekends, for youth ages 9-12 affected by the substance use disorder of a family member. All camp activities are provided free of charge.
service.application_process: Application forms available online.

service.name: Access ID Clinic - Opportunity Council
service.description: Support for obtaining a Washington State ID or Enhanced ID Card. Whatcom County residents at or below 200% federal poverty level are eligible to participate. Email for current clinic dates.

service.name: Community Engagement Service
service.description: Max Higbee Center members are paired with a Community Engagement provider to receive one-on-one support to introduce community resources and create lasting relationships, develop goals and strategies, and learn skills that will facilitate integration into the community. This program is contracted through DDA and must be approved by your case manager prior to program start.

service.name: VA Social Work
service.description: Social workers are able to help Veterans, families and caregivers with almost any need, from help with finances or housing to questions about treatment to just feeling overwhelmed.

service.name: Dementia Support NW Support Services
service.description: A comprehensive set of supports for community members living with dementia, as well as those providing their care. Services include a variety of support groups, art classes, memory screenings, and dementia-friendly events.

service.name: VA Audiology and Speech
service.description: Can diagnose and treat conditions affecting Veterans' hearing, speech or balance. These include hearing loss, tinnitus, and dizziness, as well as speech, language, voice, or swallowing disorders.

service.name: Humane Education - WHS
service.description: Hands-on programs focusing on K-12, such as classroom presentations, shelter tours and service projects. Classroom topics include: compassion and kindness towards animals, dog bite prevention and safety, spay/neuter education, animal cruelty and neglect, native wildlife safety, animal identification (i.e. dog licenses/cat id tags), and safety.

service.name: Office of Manufactured/Mobile Home Relocation Assistance
service.description: If you own your manufactured or mobile home and live in a community that is closing in Washington State, you may be eligible for relocation assistance. Manufactured and mobile home relocation assistance is provided to eligible low-income households on a first-come, first-served basis.
service.application_process: Apply online.

service.name: Parents as Teachers
service.description: A nation-wide, evidence-based service where certified parent educators visit families in the comfort of their homes a minimum of twice monthly to support parents in developing the skills and confidence needed to raise healthy, children.

service.name: Nurse-Family Partnership
service.description: A free, supportive program for women having their first baby. When you enroll in NFP, you are connected with your own personal nurse who visits with you during pregnancy and until your baby turns two years old. This program has been proven to benefit the health and well being of families. First time low-income moms in Whatcom County can enroll in the program prior to their 28th week of pregnancy.
service.application_process: Download a referral form online, or call for more information about enrollment.

service.name: Oxford House Connelly
service.description: Clean and sober housing for men.

service.name: Consumer Debt Clinic
service.description: If you want to talk to an attorney about filing for bankruptcy, call CLEAR to talk to an attorney who will screen you for eligibility, may be able to offer you initial legal advice, and may refer you to LAW Advocates for assistance from a volunteer attorney.

service.name: Share the Love Cloth Diaper Bank
service.description: Low-income families who receive assistance from programs like WIC and TANF may be able to receive a set of cloth diapers for free.
service.application_process: Register online.

service.name: Sumas Community Clothesline
service.description: A free clothing bank for residents of Sumas and surrounding communities.

service.name: NWYS Employment and Education Support
service.description: Provides in-person or remote support and community resource referrals so that youth may explore, identify, and achieve their goals in employment and education.

service.name: Child Find Screenings - LSD
service.description: A screening to identify any factors that may interfere with a child’s learning, growth and development. The screening is also provided to help parents identify their child’s strengths and weaknesses and provide home suggestions and/or further evaluation if needed in any area of concern. Any child, birth to five, whose family or care givers would like more information about their child’s development can contact their local school district to receive a free Child Find Screening.

service.name: Interfaith Coalition Winter Warmth Drive
service.description: Annual drive to gather donated winter coats, hats, gloves, and other warm items. Donations are distributed to local agencies serving people experiencing homelessness each winter.

service.name: LGBT National Coming Out Support Hotline
service.description:
A non-profit hotline staffed with volunteers who all identify as part of the LGBTQIA+ community. Volunteers can help you when you
are struggling with coming out to yourself, coming out to friends & family, facing fear and isolation, or searching for local resources.

service.name: Meals on Wheels
service.description: Delivers up to 7 nutritionally balanced meals per week to homebound seniors throughout Whatcom County. Meals are provided on a donation-only basis, no eligible senior is turned away due to inability to contribute. Eligible participants must be age 60 or older, homebound, and have difficulty shopping for/and or safely preparing nutritious meals.
service.application_process: To request meals for yourself or a loved one, complete the online form, or call.

service.name: Sangha Mamas
service.description: Sangha Mamas are a group of mamas and grand-mamas who share a common intention to practice the dharma and to be present for adventures in parenting. Available via Zoom.

service.name: Village Circle
service.description: A peer support group for birthing parents of all kinds that meets twice a month via Zoom.
service.application_process: Online only. Drop in, no registration required.

service.name: Come As You Are Support Group
service.description: A parenting peer support group for all parents and caregivers, including non-birthing parents and fathers. Meets twice a month for 1.5 hours. In-person and Zoom options available.
service.application_process: Drop in, no registration required.

service.name: Aged, Blind, or Disabled Program (ABD)
service.description: Health care coverage for individuals who are age 65 and over, blind or disabled who meet income and resource requirements.

service.name: Basic Food Employment and Training Program - Opportunity Council
service.description: Assists federally funded Basic Food (SNAP) participants gain skills, training or work experience to increase their ability to attain a living wage career.

service.name: Familia Latina
service.description: Support for families in times of crisis, as well as weekly and monthly classes and activities for the whole family, and parenting classes in Spanish. Services are completely free.
service.application_process: Call for more information.

service.name: Foundational Community Support Employment Program
service.description: Offers services to job seekers who are on Medicaid.

service.name: YWCA Housing Programs
service.description: YWCA Bellingham offers three different housing programs for women experiencing homelessness: Emergency Shelter, Senior Housing (specifically for women ages 55+), and Supported Rental Housing. Visit Opportunity Council's Community Resource Center to apply.
service.application_process: Visit Opportunity Council's Community Resource Center at 1111 Cornwall Ave. to apply.

service.name: Kelly Services
service.description: Connecting talented people with companies in need of their skills

service.name: LGBT National Senior Hotline
service.description: Confidential peer support for the LGBT and questioning community ages 50 and above.

service.name: Family Help Line
service.description: A statewide toll-free help line available to parents, caregivers, and anyone who has questions about a child in their community.  The Family Help Line can help you find resources, parenting classes, and community events, and can provide you with someone to talk to and problem solve with.

service.name: Street Law Clinic
service.description: Volunteer lawyers provide free, brief legal consultations. Come prepared with any papers related to your case. Call for more information about upcoming clinics.

service.name: Victim Advocacy and Support - Dawson Place
service.description: Victim advocates support child victims of abuse and families throughout the entire process. They offer emotional support, victim's rights information, assist in finding resources, and provide help every step of the way.

service.name: Rooted in Rights
service.description: Produces videos and social media campaigns exclusively on disability rights issues. These platforms are for people with disabilities, disability rights advocates, and their allies to learn, connect, and organize for change.

service.name: NAMI Family and Friends Class
service.description: Seminar (available in 4-hour or 90-minute format) that informs and supports people who have loved ones with a mental health condition. Participants learn about diagnoses, treatment, recovery, communication strategies, crisis preparation and NAMI resources.
service.application_process: Register online or call.

service.name: WCLS Meeting Spaces
service.description: Library meeting and conference rooms are available for reservation when they are not being used by library groups or government organizations. Reservations are on a first-come, first-serve basis and may be made no more than 24 weeks in advance.
service.fees: Free for non-commercial use. Fees vary for commercial use.

service.name: Max Higbee Virtual Programs
service.description: A place for community members, Max Higbee Center staff, and program participants to recreate together no matter their physical location. This program is filled with artistic exploration, life skills workshops for greater independence, and many other creative, virtual opportunities to engage and interact.

service.name: Evergreen Supported Living
service.description: Non-profit organization that offers in-home care and support services to adults with developmental disabilities.

service.name: Sea Mar Health Education
service.description: Health Educators offer education on diabetes, prediabetes, cholesterol, blood pressure, glucometer teaching, basic nutrition, asthma, tobacco cessation, family planning, exercise, among other topics. At each visit, the health educator spends time with the patient to set goals that help the patient achieve better health outcomes.

service.name: Family Caregiver Support Program - NWRC
service.description: Provides supports to unpaid caregivers including informational resources, consultation and training, and respite care.

service.name: Medical Examinations - Dawson Place
service.description: Medical forensic evaluation services available for children who are victims of abuse.
service.application_process: Call for information

service.name: The Food Connection
service.description: A program that connects surplus food from food service establishments and other sources to families in the Blaine community that can use the food.
service.application_process: Email food@blainecap.org with your name and phone number.

service.name: Blue Skies Back to School Backpack Distribution Program
service.description: Brand new backpacks are distributed August 1 through mid-September each year. Call for distribution dates.
service.application_process: Call for distribution dates.

service.name: Stepping Stones Clean and Sober Housing
service.description: Clean and sober housing for men and women.

service.name: Know Your Rights Presentations
service.description: Presentations for community members who are interested in learning more about their legal rights. Topics covered include what to do if you are approached by a police officer or immigration official, how the latest executive actions on immigration may affect you or members of your community, and a basic introduction to the United States' immigration system. Presentations primarily offered in Spanish. Find a list of upcoming presentations online.

service.name: Al Boe Wheelchair Warehouse
service.description: Loans durable medical equipment to residents of Whatcom and Skagit Counties. Equipment loaned includes wheelchairs, walkers, crutches, canes, and bedside and bathroom helpers of all kinds.

service.name: Legal Assistance at DVSAS
service.description: Navigating the legal system can be challenging. DVSAS advocates can help with protection orders, court preparation and accompaniment, and law enforcement reporting.

service.name: Pregnant Woman Assistance Program
service.description: A state-funded program that provides women who are low-income and pregnant and who are not eligible for Temporary Assistance for Needy Families or State Family Assistance with cash assistance and a referral to the HEN program. This program provides a maximum monthly cash grant of $363.
service.application_process: You can apply for PWA online at washingtonconnection.org, by phone, or at your local Community Services Office.

service.name: VA Nutrition, Food, and Dietary Care
service.description: Nutrition experts work closely with Veterans to help make sure they are getting the nutrition they need to get and stay as healthy as possible.

service.name: CAST
service.description: Coffee and sandwiches served at the Arch of Healing and Reconciliation behind the downtown Bellingham Library four nights a week, rain or shine, throughout the year.

service.name: Nooksack Valley Food Bank - Everson
service.description: Provides produce, canned goods, breads, meat, and dairy items. No ID or proof of address required. Income guidelines are currently 400% of Federal Poverty Level.

service.name: Lions Foundation Hearing Program
service.description: Provides hearing tests and hearing aids for those in need. $50 copay required, all other costs covered by Bellingham Central Lions Club and the Lions Foundation.
service.application_process: Download an application online, complete the application, include proof of income and email to dancantrell1@yahoo.com, or mail to: Bellingham Central Lions Club (BCLC) attention Hearing Program Director P.O. Box 602, Bellingham, WA 98227

service.name: Nonprofit Resources - BPL
service.description: Research grants and learn skills to build the capacity of your nonprofit.
service.fees: Free to Bellingham Public Library card holders

service.name: Salvation Army Food Bank
service.description: Client choice model where people can come and choose their own food items that best fit their needs.

service.name: Weatherization Plus Health Program
service.description: Identifies indoor air quality improvements for a home, including mold and moisture reduction, pest mitigation and air quality improvements that can  help reduce asthma triggers and improve indoor environments. Available for both homeowners and renters with landlords permission.

service.name: Family Counseling  - TouchStone
service.description: Families often feel stress and distress with the challenges of changing family dynamics: the blending of households, co-parenting after divorce, adoption or fostering, loss of a family member, or caring for aging parents. Family counselors can help find solutions, facilitate discussion, and replace frustration with effective strategies.
service.fees: All insurance providers accepted, sliding scale available if no insurance.

service.name: NWYS Rental Assistance
service.description: Provides rental assistance for young adults 18-24 years old.

service.name: Pregnancy and Childbirth Care at PeaceHealth
service.description: PeaceHealth and its partner organizations offer prenatal, labor and delivery and postpartum services. You can plan your care to fit your health needs or preferences. Your care team may include specialists in midwifery, high-risk pregnancy, newborn (neonatal) care or breastfeeding.

service.name: Our Treehouse Teen Night
service.description: A peer-support group for teens to explore their feelings through facilitator led conversations and creative processes.
service.application_process: Contact to apply.

service.name: City of Bellingham Mobile Home Repair
service.description: Assists Bellingham homeowners with limited repairs that can address health and safety, durability issues, and energy efficiency measures.

service.name: CCS Recovery Center
service.description: Outpatient Substance Use Disorder treatment services for youth, adults, and their families.

service.name: Help Find Child Care
service.description: Use the online search tool or call the Family Center for help finding high-quality, licensed child care near you.

service.name: BTC Automotive Program
service.description: Discounted automotive services. All customer work selected must coincide with current class room curriculum. Vehicles older than 15 years typically will not be selected unless they meet a specific teaching requirement.
service.application_process: To submit your request please complete the online Automotive work form

service.name: Independent Living - LWC
service.description: Apartment complexes providing safe and affordable housing in the community to Lake Whatcom Center clients. Rental assistance and subsidies provided by Bellingham and Whatcom County Housing Authorities.

service.name: Unity Care NW Children's Dental Care
service.description: Provides dental care to children, pregnant women, and the parents of children who are UCNW patients.
service.fees: Apple Health (Medicaid), Medicare, and private insurance accepted. Sliding Fee Discount Program available based on household size and income.

service.name: Trauma Therapy - Hope and Thrive Counseling
service.description: Counseling services to help learn coping skills to manage and reduce the symptoms of the trauma experienced.
service.fees: Health insurance, sliding scale fee, and all major forms of payment accepted.

service.name: GED/High School Completion Classes - Goodwill
service.description: Goodwill offers two different programs to help people get their high school diploma or GED. High School 21+ program allows colleges to grant high school diplomas to individuals who are 21 years or older. Basic Skills & GED Test Preparation classes helps students prepare for all four GED test subject areas (writing, math, science, and social studies) as well as improving test-taking skills, digital skills, and taking practice tests.
service.application_process: Call or register online.
service.fees: Financial support to cover cost of testing available to qualifying students.

service.name: VA Women Veteran Care
service.description: Women’s health services to meet specific needs such as disease screenings, mental health treatment, recovery from military sexual trauma, maternity care and female-specific medical equipment.

service.name: Child Care Check
service.description: Washington State's licensed child care status and record data base. Search providers and find out background check statuses, licensing history, monitoring reports and more.

service.name: On the Money
service.description: Independent classes focusing on increasing knowledge of credit, debt management, savings strategies, asset building, tax information and more.

service.name: Blue Skies Winter Warm-Up Distribution Program
service.description: Provides children in need with a new or gently used coat, hat, gloves, scarf, hooded sweatshirt and/or blanket. The program is generally available in November/December/January each year.
service.application_process: Call to set an appointment the last week of October, and an application will be mailed to you.​

service.name: Mindfullness Skills Training
service.description: Mindfulness training is intended to improve quality of life and aid in the management of conditions including stress, chronic pain, depression, and anxiety. Therapy sessions include meditation exercises as well as purposeful awareness-building of the various facets of wellness, including physical, social and familial, mental/emotional, intellectual, occupational/academic, and environmental wellness.

service.name: Division of Child Support
service.description: Support services for paying and receiving child support.

service.name: Rental Assistance - Opportunity Council
service.description: Opportunity Council administers the Federal Emergency Rental Assistance program for residents in Whatcom, Island, and San Juan Counties. Apply online.

service.name: Low-Cost Microchip - WHS
service.description: 1 in 3 pets will get lost in their lifetime, and this permanent form of identification could be your pet’s ticket home. WHS offers this lifesaving service for just $30.00. No appointment necessary.

service.name: Attorney General of Washington
service.description: Provides consumer protection for identity theft and scams, education, labor and industries, licensing, social and health services.

service.name: Red Cross Disaster Relief and Recovery
service.description: From small house fires to multi-state natural disasters, the American Red Cross goes wherever needed to provide clean water, safe shelter, and hot meals to those impacted by a disaster.

service.name: Wild Whatcom Nature Preschool
service.description: Program for children ages 3-5 who are potty-trained. Children spend time connecting with and learning about our local natural environment as well as getting used to group dynamics and following instructions.
service.fees: Fees vary by program, call for information. Scholarships available.

service.name: Small Claims Mediation
service.description: Mediating a small claims case is an excellent choice for clients involved in Small Claims actions. In mediation, clients are able to consider remedies to satisfy their conflict that the court is not able to address.
service.application_process: Call to request mediation before your court date, OR request mediation at court on the day of your hearing (if both parties agree, mediation is available on site as an alternative to a trial with a judge).
service.fees: Services are free for all parties involved in Small Claims disputes that have been filed in Whatcom County District Court

service.name: East Whatcom Regional Resource Center
service.description: Provides general information and resources for the Maple Falls community. Resources include computer and phone access, notary, hygiene and health supplies, clothes, books, toys, household items, specialized intake support such as SNAP benefits, and more. Diapers available depending on supply, call ahead to check.

service.name: WCLS Events Calendar
service.description: Calendar of Whatcom County Library System events, including story times, social gatherings, book clubs, and more.

service.name: Separation, Divorce, and Parenting Plan Mediation
service.description: Process for families experiencing separation or divorce to develop or modify parenting plans, negotiate property divisions, and address other issues.
service.application_process: Call to speak with a case manager

service.name: Nooksack Behavioral Health
service.description: Offers comprehensive and culturally sensitive mental health counseling services to the Nooksack Tribal community and Native Americans living in the area (families, elders, adults, adolescents and children).

service.name: Foster Parent Services
service.description: Ensures foster parents are prepared through Foster Class, supported through ongoing Foster Family Support Groups, and backed by an attentive team of Foster Care Specialists.

service.name: Nooksack Food Bank
service.description: Provides food to anyone in need on the first Friday of each month. Located behind the Social Services building.

service.name: CLEAR*Sr
service.description: A toll-free legal hotline for seniors (age 60 and over). Services are targeted to problems that affect basic needs such as housing, income, medical care and family safety. Due to limited resources, lawyers and paralegals are not able to assist every caller.

service.name: DVSAS Partnership
service.description: The Domestic Violence and Sexual Assault Services (DVSAS) Partnership Program provides case management and housing resource access to one of DVSAS’ two safe shelters, and to clients in emergency motel stays paid for by DVSAS. (Referral made by DVSAS).
service.application_process: If you are interested in this program, please contact Opportunity Council or DVSAS.

service.name: Mobile Crisis Outreach Team (MCOT)
service.description: A community-based outreach team with the ability to respond to and provide crisis services in the community (e.g., homes, schools, shelters). The Team serves adults, adolescents, and children who are experiencing a behavioral health (mental health and/or substance use) crisis regardless of their funding source. MCOT offers short term crisis intervention and prevention services utilizing strength-based, solution-focused, culturally competent, trauma-informed, and recovery-oriented interventions.
service.application_process: Call the Care Crisis Line at 1-800-584-3578 24/7 – 365 days-a-year to speak with a mental health professional who will assess the situation, make appropriate referrals, and/or dispatch the MCOT community based outreach team.

service.name: Neighborhood Nature
service.description: An after school program that connects kids with the outdoors through exploration, play, art, and nature activities. Available for grades K-5.
service.application_process: Online form available.
service.fees: Fees vary by program, call for information. Scholarships available.

service.name: Training Workshops - WA Autism Alliance
service.description: Practical information provided through web-based trainings and workshops.
service.application_process: Register online.

service.name: Mental Health Counseling and Training (Answers Counseling)
service.description: Adults with Apple Health/ Medicaid health insurance are eligible for in-person and tele-counseling sessions.

service.name: Unity Care NW Outreach and Enrollment Specialists
service.description: If you do not have insurance, an Outreach and Enrollment Specialist can tell you what you may qualify for and walk you through the application process.

service.name: Lynden Family Community Services
service.description: Helps students and families connect with school and community resources.

service.name: National Call Center for Homeless Veterans
service.description: Veterans who are homeless or at risk of homelessness—and their family members, friends and supporters—can make the call to or chat online with the National Call Center for Homeless Veterans, where trained counselors are ready to talk confidentially 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

service.name: WWIN Star Scholars
service.description: Scholarship for women with awards up to $5,000 each academic year towards the Cost of Attendance.
service.application_process: Apply online January through April.

service.name: HSDC Deaf and Hard of Hearing Services
service.description: Provides free case management, advocacy, and information to deaf and hard of hearing individuals throughout Western Washington. In addition, HSDC conducts outreach workshops for organizations who wish to better serve their deaf and hard of hearing clients, customers, and staff.
service.application_process: Contact HSDC for more information.

service.name: Wild Whatcom Summer Camps
service.description: Summer camp programs for grades 1 - 8. Activities include all-day outdoor adventures, mentor-facilitated learning and discovery, and wilderness skills development.
service.fees: Fees vary by program, call for information. Scholarships available.

service.name: Hope House
service.description: Basic Needs provided free of charge to those in need in our community. Resources include clothing, household goods, toiletries, cleaning supplies, diapers, emergency food, and more.

service.name: Sumas Senior Center
service.description: A warm and friendly place for seniors and other members of the community to gather for food, fun and community events each week. *NOTICE* The Sumas Community Center is currently closed due to flood damage. Seniors are welcome at the Everson center for meals and activities.

service.name: Text 4 STEM
service.description: Texting service for Native youth to re-affirm Native voices in science, technology, engineering, and math, by connecting Native youth to Native professionals who work in STEM fields.
service.application_process: Register online to subscribe.
service.fees: Standard text messaging rates may apply.

service.name: Oxford House Journey
service.description: Clean and sober housing for women.

service.name: Kaleidoscope Play and Learn Groups
service.description: Play group for children ages 0 - 5. Meet weekly to connect with families and caregivers around songs, stories, and show and tell, and offer support as needed.

service.name: Whatcom Homeless Service Center
service.description: Provides referrals to housing services to prevent and end homelessness. Apply through the Community Resource Center.
service.application_process: Contact the Community Resource Center to apply for services.

service.name: Compass Health Payeeship and Finance Management Services
service.description: Current Compass Health clients can apply for payee services through their clinician.  If you are not currently a client at Compass Health, but wish to sign up for payee/financial management services you can call to enroll. The payee program is able to pay rent, utilities and other bills on time, help clients manage their finances, and provide clients with spending money each month.

service.name: Ferndale Community Utilities Fund
service.description: Helps low-income City of Ferndale water customers pay their bill when money is tight. View income eligibility guidelines and apply online.
service.application_process: Apply online

service.name: McKinney-Vento Program - NVSD
service.description: Serves students experiencing homelessness. This program is designed to reduce isolation, maximize stability and maintain consistency for this population of children and youth. Contact the liaison in your school district for support.

service.name: DVSAS Support Groups
service.description: Support groups for survivors of domestic violence and/or sexual assault. All DVSAS support groups are free and confidential.

service.name: NRI - Critical Home Repair Program
service.description: Offers major home repairs and improvements in order to maintain safe living conditions and home value. Repairs include, but are not limited to, weatherization, painting, landscaping, and roofing.
service.application_process: Complete an application online

service.name: Meals - Lynden Community / Senior Center
service.description: Meals served Monday through Friday in a variety of ways: Sit & Sup congregate meal, hot to-go meals, frozen meals, and delivery Senior Mobile Meals. $6 for fresh meals, $5 for frozen.

service.name: Directory of Washington Domestic Violence Programs
service.description: Directory of domestic violence programs throughout Washington State.

service.name: Energy Assistance - Opportunity Council
service.description: Bill assistance for home heating and energy bills. Households must be income eligible to receive assistance.  Depending on the time of year, help may be available for electricity, natural gas, propane, heating oil, and wood bills.
service.application_process: Call to apply.

service.name: Habitat Store
service.description: A nonprofit that accepts new and gently used items, such as furniture, appliances, construction supplies, hardware and more. All proceeds go toward building safe, affordable housing in Whatcom County. Free donation pickup available.

service.name: Free Museum Passes - BPL
service.description: The Bellingham Public Library has partnered with the Whatcom Museum, the Spark Museum of Electrical Invention, and Mindport Exhibits to offer complimentary general admission to each museum. A Museum Pass allows free entry for up to 4 people, valid for use on the date and at the museum selected when registering. Each family is eligible for a pass for each museum every 60 days. Register online using the library calendar of events.

service.name: Online Resource Directory for Pregnancy and Infant Loss
service.description: Curated online resources and lending library for pregnancy and infant loss.
service.application_process: Lending Library books can be picked up at support group meetings and are given out for 2 weeks.

service.name: Kinship Custody Clinic
service.description: Provides information about the procedures and issues involved with obtaining a non-parental custody order for a relative or unrelated person (often grandparents, aunts/uncles, or family friends). A family law lawyer will assist clients with court documents and instruct them in representing themselves in court to obtain a non-parental custody order. Call for more information and to register.

service.name: Early Head Start
service.description: A special Head Start program serving infants, toddlers, and pregnant parents in Whatcom County. Services include prenatal education, health and nutrition services, family development support, and home visits focusing on child development and quality early education. This program is for income eligible families.
service.application_process: Selection process begins in early summer and continues until classes are full. Apply online, or pick up an application in person.

service.name: Behavioral Health Counseling - NWRC
service.description: Mental health and substance use counseling. Costs are covered if you are on Medicaid through Amerigroup, Community Health Plan of Washington (CHPW), Molina, or United Healthcare. NWRC is not able to accept Medicaid fee-for-service, Coordinated Care, Medicare, private pay, or private insurance at this time.
service.fees: NWRC only accepts payment through Medicaid insurance from the following MCO's: Amerigroup, Community Health Plan of Washington, Molina, and United Healthcare.

service.name: Bellingham Food Bank
service.description: Provides free groceries to anyone in Bellingham. Up to two visits per week allowed per household. Pick up for up to two households per visit.

service.name: Family Funds Program
service.description: Provides funding for emergency basic needs for families in need within the Ferndale School District. Funds can cover housing costs, clothing, food, utilities, school and other household supplies, or other things recommended by District staff for families. Services provided to families working with select Ferndale School District staff.
service.application_process: Referral from select Ferndale School District staff required.

service.name: LGBT National Hotline
service.description: Provides telephone, online private one-to-one chat, and email peer-support, as well as factual information and local resources for cities and towns across the United States.

service.name: Lummi Nation Housing Authority
service.description: Provides subsidized housing for Native Americans. Lummi Tribal members are prioritized.
service.application_process: Call to apply.

service.name: WTA Bus Passes - Opportunity Council
service.description: Free WTA 6-ride passes distributed as available at the Community Resource Center. Limit 2 per person per visit. A limited supply is also available at East Whatcom Regional Resource Center.

service.name: DentistLink
service.description:
A free non-profit referral service connecting everyone to dental care. DentistLink can help find the right dental care for you, whether you are uninsured or insured, including help with transportation to a dental appointment, help with interpretation services, and more. Search the online directory, call or text the DentistLink team, or fill out an online form 
to be matched with a dentist.

service.name: Subsidized Housing Programs - BHA
service.description: Bellingham Housing Authority owns and manages properties that are rented to eligible households at a subsidized rate. This program can serve families, seniors, and those with disabilities. Households pay 30% of their income for rent.
service.application_process: All applications are done online through the Applicant Portal.

service.name: Meeting Rooms - BPL
service.description: Three group meeting rooms are available at Bellingham Public Library facilities for free-of-charge public use during library open hours. Meeting rooms may only be used for non-commercial purposes. Users may register for one use per month, and may reserve rooms up to 90 days in advance. Reservation requests may be submitted online or by phone.

service.name: Alcoholics Anonymous Hotline
service.description: If you think you may have a problem with drinking and want to talk with a member of Alcoholics Anonymous, call the 24/7 hotline.

service.name: Nooksack Housing Department
service.description: Provides housing opportunities for Nooksack families. Services include Low Rent Program, programs leading to eventual homeownership, and waiting list of Tribal members in need of affordable housing. Nooksack Housing also helps Tribal members connect with other state and federal housing services, including the Section 184 Home Loan Program, Down Payment Assistance, as well as other administrative assistance.
service.application_process: Print and complete the Nooksack Housing Application, then return it to the Housing Department.

service.name: Wonder Walks
service.description: For people ages 18+ to explore the natural history of local parks on meandering walks meant to engage your senses and deepen your sense of place.
service.application_process: Weekly registration opens every Friday for the following Friday’s outing. Available on a first-come, first-served basis. Register online.

service.name: CostPlus Drug Company
service.description: Web-based prescription drug company offering generic brand prescription medications at low cost.
service.application_process: Download prescriber cover letter online and provide it to your doctor, or have your doctor send prescriptions to CostPlus pharmacy.

service.name: NAMI Family-to-Family Class
service.description: The 8-session, 4 week course is taught by trained family members and is for families, partners and friends of individuals with mental illnesses. The course is designed to facilitate a better understanding of mental illness, increase coping skills and empower participants to become advocates for their loved ones.
service.application_process: Register online or call.

service.name: WHSC Housing Navigator
service.description: Provides housing search and application support, help developing a renter's portfolio, renter education, referrals to community resources, and tools for housing retention. Drop-in hours Monday - Friday, 1 - 4 PM, or by appointment.

service.name: PeaceHealth Behavioral Health
service.description: Trained behavioral health specialists including psychiatrists, psychologists, social workers, therapists, mental health counselors and other specialists. PeaceHealth Behavioral Health services can treat conditions including addiction, drug & alcohol abuse, anxiety, bipolar disorder, brain disorders, child development conditions, chronic pain, depression, eating disorders, obsessive compulsive disorder, post traumatic stress disorder, and schizophrenia.

service.name: Homeless Outreach Team
service.description: Connects people experiencing homelessness with services, and supports community members in working through issues surrounding homelessness.

service.name: HUSLY Temporary Shelter
service.description:
Temporary housing program for young adults ages 18 to 24. Provides four beds at each location (Bellingham and Mt. Vernon) where young adults can stay for up to 90 days. Note: HUSLY is accessed through a main application process and is NOT first come, first served.

​
service.application_process:
Contact the housing coordinator Rebecca to ask questions and get started on their housing process. 

​

service.name: Trans Lifeline Hotline
service.description: A 24/7 peer support phone service run by trans people for trans and questioning peers.

service.name: WCLS Library Cards
service.description: Apply online or in person to receive a free library card.

service.name: Whatcom County Veterans Program
service.description: A point of entry to local, state and federal benefits and services for veterans. Services include burial assistance, compensation and pension assistance, employment assistance, health services, housing assistance, legal assistance, social service programs, temporary financial assistance, and transportation.
service.application_process: Call or email to schedule an appointment. There are currently no walk-in hours available.

service.name: GRADS
service.description: GRADS (Graduation, Reality, And Dual-role Skills) is a program for pregnant and parenting students that provides the academic and childcare support necessary to stay in high school and graduate. Available at no cost to parents under age 21 who live in Whatcom County.
service.application_process: Talk to your school counselor, school nurse or other caring adults to learn more about GRADS options for your education.

service.name: DACA General Information & Resources
service.description: General information and resources about DACA (Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals) including important updates and renewal clinics.

service.name: Whatcom/Skagit AA Meeting Schedule
service.description: Check the online calendar to find in-person and online Alcoholics Anonymous meetings near you.

service.name: Disability Mobility Initiative
service.description: Organizing for a future where nondrivers can access our communities.

service.name: WCLS Learning Resources
service.description: Library-created learning resources for both parents and educators to help children become their best selves. Resources include Early Literacy Kits, Preschool Theme Kits, Baby Boxes, People of the Salish Sea Curriculum Kits, homeschooling resources, and more. Additionally, call your local branch to schedule a school visit to the library, or to request a library visit to your school.

service.name: The PAD
service.description:
Emergency housing program that offers housing for minors, ages 13-17 years for up to 90 days. Emergency housing helps youth reprieve and recover from crises, access critical services, and begin to set future goals for safety and stability.
​
service.application_process: No application is required. Staff are on-site and available 24 hours a day to support any youth in crisis.

service.name: Lummi Victims of Crime
service.description: Helps adults or adolescents who have been affected by domestic violence, sexual assault, elder abuse, assault & battery, survivor of homicide, and child abuse.  Services include: crisis counseling, advocacy for domestic violence and sexual assault crimes, safety planning, legal advocacy, transportation to medical, legal, and therapy appointments, Domestic Violence shelter, traditional healing and emergency assistance.
service.application_process: Must call to determine if eligible for programs.

service.name: Toddler Time
service.description: Drop-in community playgroups located in Bellingham, Ferndale, and Lynden. Donations by participants help cover the costs of drop-in playgroups.

service.name: Safe Spaces Program
service.description: Provides an access point for community members to make a complaint due to concerns about the City of Bellingham’s services, or their experience interacting with or within the City of Bellingham.
service.application_process: Call, complete online form, or print and mail form

service.name: PeaceHealth Pediatrics
service.description: Pediatric services can help with a child's primary and special health needs, as well as emergencies.

service.name: Eviction Help - NJP
service.description: Tenants facing eviction can apply for free legal help from Northwest Justice Project and other local legal aid providers by calling the Eviction Defense line.
service.application_process: Fill out the online form in English or Spanish or call the Eviction Defense line at 1-855-657-8387. Interpreters available in all languages.

service.name: The Ground Floor
service.description: A day-use center for at-risk, runaway and homeless youth ages 24 and under. Youth can connect with supportive adults, receive basic needs items such as food, clothing and gear for sleeping outside, and connect with other resources that will help them end their experience of homelessness.

service.name: Compass Health Adult Outpatient Services
service.description: Provides a broad spectrum of counseling services to adult clients who have mental health issues. This service gives the assistance clients need to reduce or manage their mental health symptoms by improving their coping and daily living skills. Services include individual, family, and group therapy, as well as community support services.

service.name: Anxiety Counseling - Hope and Thrive Counseling
service.description: Counseling services to help individuals cope with anxiety.
service.fees: Health insurance, sliding scale fee, and all major forms of payment accepted.

service.name: Text Healers
service.description: Texting service for Native youth to re-affirm Native voices in health and wellness professions. Weekly tips and inspiration for Native youth interested in a health profession.
service.application_process: Register online to get connected.

service.name: Cascade Connections Training Center
service.description: Offers both classroom and online certifications as well as continuing education classes to prepare students for home care aide certification and state test.

service.name: WABC Money Management Resources
service.description: Information, tips, and resources to help you effectively manage your money. Topics include budgeting, saving, credit, debt, banking, and taxes.

service.name: Wild Whatcom Community Field Trips
service.description: Outdoor group outings to explore local parks, beaches, and trails, available to anyone.
service.application_process: Online form available.

service.name: Parent Child Assistance Program
service.description: An award winning, evidence‐informed home visitation case‐management model for pregnant and parenting women with substance use disorders.  The program serves pregnant and parenting moms in recovery with children up to age 2.
service.application_process: Call to enroll.

service.name: NWYS Rapid Rehousing
service.description: This program is for young people, ages 18-24, who are moving out of unstable situations that resulted in them being temporarily homeless. This program offers lease support, housing financial assistance, deposit, and ongoing skill building in collaboration with Housing Case Managers.

service.name: Tuition Preschool - NVSD
service.description: Integrated preschool classrooms that serve preschool children with developmental delays as well as their typically developing peers.
service.application_process: Call to learn more about the program and enrollment.
service.fees: Tuition only applies to typically developing peers. Waivers available.

service.name: WABC Resource Library
service.description: Online library of resource guides, educational videos, and informational posters created by Opportunity Council's Community Resource Center in partnership with WABC. Find resource guides for food, clothing, hygiene, housing, and more in PDF format.

service.name: Sober Living Program - Contact Counseling
service.description: Helping people who are in early recovery to learn to live a life of recovery. The program requires drug screening, behavior contracts and attendance of twelve step programs as well as other mandatory requirements. Contact Counseling Recovery Services operates two sober living houses: Art Bergh House for men and Helen House for women.
service.application_process: Application available online

service.name: Village Circle Group Peer Support Services
service.description: Virtual and in-person support groups for any birthing person and/or anyone identifying as a mother.
service.application_process: Virtual meeting link available online at website.

service.name: PEPS Newborn Program
service.description: Program designed for parents to attend with their babies aged 2-16 weeks old when the group starts. Groups come together for 2 hours, once a week, for 12 weeks, with time for sharing parenting highs and lows, to focus on the babies' development and a discussion topic.
service.fees: Sliding scale, flexible pricing. Call for details.

service.name: Developmental Preschool - BPS
service.description: Early childhood preschool programs provide a language-based curriculum to students ages 3-4 who have been identified with developmental delays and qualify for special education services. Programs provide direct, integrated, and/or consultative services to students with mild to moderate disabilities in general education. Contact your school district to apply.
service.application_process: Complete the online application if you are interested in participating in screening activities for the purpose of locating, identifying and evaluating your child’s  potential disabilities and need of special education services.

service.name: Cascade Connections Home Care
service.description: In home care for adults and children with developmental disabilities, and individuals with traumatic brain injury (TBI). Services include personal hygiene assistance, meal planning and preparation, housework and laundry, shopping for groceries and clothes, medication management and supervision, escort to medical appointments, bed and mobility transfers, respite services, and more.
service.application_process: Call to set up a meeting.

service.name: VA Mental Health Care
service.description: Counseling and other support for Veterans struggling with issues like PTSD, depression, grief, anger or trauma. All VA health care facilities offer same-day help. You may qualify even without enrolling in VA health care.

service.name: Sea Mar Bellingham Medical Clinic
service.description: Specializes in primary care family medicine, including preventive health exams, prenatal care, acute care visits, minor procedures, health education, follow-up care from hospital visits, and referrals.

service.name: Ask Your Relative
service.description: A team of educators, public health professionals, and caring adults supporting Native Youth through a Q&A service.

service.name: Involuntary Treatment Act Services
service.description: Designated Crisis Responders provide legal assessment of grave disability and/or danger to self or others as a result of a mental health or substance use disorder for possible involuntary detention to a behavioral health facility. As a component of the evaluation, it must be determined that other, less restrictive options for stabilization of the crisis have been ruled out or deemed inappropriate.
service.application_process: Call the Care Crisis Line at 1-800-584-3578 24 hours-a-day, 365 days-a-year to speak with a mental health professional who will assess the situation and make appropriate referrals.

service.name: Bankruptcy Counseling and Education - Clearpoint
service.description: Allows you to fulfill the requirements set forth by bankruptcy law and gives you access to a certified credit counselor.

service.name: Free Shower Program
service.description:
Free showers are available for anyone in need at Arne Hanna Aquatic Center. Showers are open to the public Monday - Friday, 6:00 AM - 4:00 PM, and Saturday - Sunday, 1:00 PM - 5:00 PM. 

The Aquatic Center will be closed for annual maintenance 7/29/2023 - 8/20/2023.

service.name: Senior Community Meals - Bellingham
service.description: Offers older adults the opportunity to connect with each other while enjoying a delicious, nutritionally balanced meal. Meals provided on a donation only basis for adults age 60 and over, as well as their spouses and caregivers.

service.name: City of Bellingham Community Garden Program
service.description: Program participants can take advantage of 200 square feet of garden space to grow their own food and flowers. Registration for new gardeners begins in January each year on a first-come-first-served basis.  Returning gardeners who want the same plots are given priority to register for their same plots starting in November for the following year.
service.fees: Fee per plot per calendar year. Scholarships available.

service.name: Child Care for Families Experiencing Homelessness
service.description: Families with young children who are experiencing homelessness can get help finding child care at no cost to them for up to 12 months. Child care offers young children experiencing homelessness a safe place to play and learn, healthy food and a chance to make friends.

service.name: Explorers Club
service.description: A cohort-style outdoor education program for youth in grades 2 - 12. Outings focus on developing naturalist knowledge, cultivating leadership skills, and creating lasting connections to nature and community.
service.application_process: Online form available.
service.fees: Fees vary by program, call for information. Scholarships available.

service.name: Assisted Living - LWC
service.description: Assisted Living Facilities providing 24/7 staff supervision to clients experiencing severe and persistent mental illness in a residential treatment setting. Residential treatment offers a safe location for Clients to receive mental health treatment in a community-like setting.
service.application_process: Complete a Referral Application available online, gather documentation, return application to Lake Whatcom Center.

service.name: NAMI Grupo de Apoyo para Familiares
service.description: En los Grupos de Apoyo para Familiares de NAMI, las familias se ayudan los unos a otros mediante el uso de sus experiencias y aprendizajes de cómo lidiar con las enfermedades mentales. Cada dos semanas los Miércoles a las 5:00 - 6:00 PM.

service.name: Horsemanship for Veterans
service.description: Weekly one-on-one or group equine therapy sessions with a Mental Health & Family Counselor and their team of horses. These sessions are conducted onsite at a peaceful, secluded farm, and are tailored to the needs of each participant.
service.application_process: Go online to website and click "request an application".

service.name: Refugee Cash Assistance
service.description: Helps eligible refugees and other humanitarian immigrants by providing cash assistance for up to eight months from their arrival date in the United States (or from the date of their immigration status for asylees or victims of trafficking). RCA is for eligible people who do not have minor children.
service.application_process: You can apply for RCA online at washingtonconnection.org, by phone, or at your local Community Services Office.

service.name: Columbia Valley Woodstove Change-Out Program
service.description: Helps residents in the Columbia Valley urban growth area of Whatcom County replace old woodstoves with new, certified wood or pellet stoves and/or heat pumps. Open to Columbia Valley residents who meet certain qualifications.
service.application_process: Contact Opportunity Council at 360-734-5121 ext. 1102 or eryn_spellman@oppco.org to see if you qualify for the program.

service.name: McKinney-Vento Program - BSD
service.description: Serves students experiencing homelessness. This program is designed to reduce isolation, maximize stability and maintain consistency for this population of children and youth. Contact the liaison in your school district for support.

service.name: Whatcom-Skagit Housing
service.description: Provides assistance to help low-income households build their own homes. Apply online to be added to the waitlist (currently about 3.5 years wait time).
service.application_process: Apply online.

service.name: Social Security Retirement Benefits
service.description: A monthly check that replaces part of your income when you reduce your hours or stop working altogether. It may not replace all your income so it's best to identify other ways to pay for your monthly expenses as you age.
service.application_process: Submit an application online (English only), or call to set up an appointment.

service.name: Sea Mar Bellingham Dental Clinic
service.description: Specializes in family dentistry including preventive dental exams, emergency or urgent care, and referrals.

service.name: Nooksack Genesis II Chemical Dependency Program
service.description: Provides confidential, comprehensive services for substance abuse and chemical dependency, as well as outpatient treatment.

service.name: Child Find Screenings (BSD)
service.description: A screening to identify any factors that may interfere with a child’s learning, growth and development. The screening is also provided to help parents identify their child’s strengths and weaknesses and provide home suggestions and/or further evaluation if needed in any area of concern. Any child, birth to five, whose family or care givers would like more information about their child’s development can contact their local school district to receive a free Child Find Screening.
service.application_process: Screenings can be completed for any child, birth to age five, whose family or caregiver would like more information about their child’s development.

service.name: Family Promise
service.description: Family shelter and day center for families with children.
service.application_process: Contact the Opportunity Council for screening and intake.

service.name: Our One-Time Little Wishes Program
service.description: Grants Little Wishes to children ages 6 to 18 for support of school trip fees, summer camp enrollment fees, bicycle and helmet, special needs equipment, tutoring, computers, school related supplies, sports fees and/or uniforms, cleats, and other items.
service.application_process: Download application online.

service.name: Community First Choice Personal Care
service.description: A state Medicaid program (formerly Medicaid Personal Care, or MPC) for people on Medicaid who need help with activities of daily living, including eating, dressing, bathing, or mobility. The program is administered by the Developmental Disabilities Administration (DDA), even for people who are not eligible for DDA. Personal Care services are typically provided in your home.
service.application_process: For those on Medicaid with a DDA case manager, call your DDA case manager to apply for CFC Personal Care. For those on Medicaid who do not have a DDA case manager, call (360) 714-5000 to apply for CFC Personal Care.

service.name: Play Groups - PREPARES
service.description: Play Groups provide an opportunity for mothers of pre-school children to get together, along with their children, on a weekly basis. These groups foster a learning environment for the children while creating a supportive environment for the moms to build relationships with each other.
service.application_process: Call or email for details, or online referral form available.

service.name: Nooksack Tribal Dental Clinic
service.description: Provides dental care to the Nooksack Indian Tribe and eligible members of federally recognized tribes. Offers comprehensive dental services, including general dentistry, pediatric dentistry, oral health prevention education, and other dental services.

service.name: Job and Career Workshops - Goodwill
service.description: Free career/job readiness workshops on topics including resumes, job finding, interviewing, and more.
service.application_process: Call or register online.

service.name: Lynden Hop
service.description: On-demand service allows riders to hail a ride anywhere within Lynden using a mobile app. Lynden Hop is open to everyone, and just $1 per ride. All vans are wheelchair accessible. Dowload the WTA Ride mobile app to book a ride.

service.name: WCEL Playgroups and Classes
service.description: Interactive programs that allow children to learn and play in group environments with other children and their parents/caregivers. These programs are for children to develop skills and experience peer group socialization.

service.name: Recreation Mentor Project
service.description: Max Higbee Center members are paired with a Recreation Leader to receive one-on-one support to create an individualized, goal-oriented and community-based recreation experience. This service is highly flexible and allows for people to schedule sessions that are tailored and designed based on short-term and long-term goals.

service.name: Redemption Place
service.description: Faith-based clean and sober housing for men.
service.application_process: Download application online.

service.name: Crisis Text Line- The Trevor Project
service.description: LGBTQ young people can text with a trained counselor for free, confidential and secure 24/7 service when they are struggling with issues such as coming out, LGBTQ identity, depression, and suicide.
service.application_process: Text "START" to reach a crisis counselor.
service.fees: Standard text messaging rates may apply.

service.name: Lydia Place Housing for Households Without Children
service.description: A mix of rapid re-housing and permanent supportive housing placements for people experiencing homelessness, these services are a partnership with the Whatcom Homeless Service Center and the Whatcom County Health Department targeting the most vulnerable adults on the Housing Pool wait list. Contact Opportunity Council to apply.
service.application_process: Visit Opportunity Council to apply for housing programs.

service.name: Compass Health Child Advocacy Program
service.description: Services provided to children and adolescents who have been, or are believed to have been, sexually abused.
service.application_process: Call the outpatient assessment line for a referral.

service.name: Community Garden - A Watered Garden
service.description: The community garden grows children's minds as well as fresh produce.
service.application_process: To participate, download an application online. Return by email, or mail to AWGFLC PO Box 218, Everson, WA 98247.

service.name: Home Repair Loan
service.description: Deferred, low-interest loans may be provided to income-qualifying homeowners to address repairs that focus on: home foundation repair or installation, roof repair or replacement, plumbing, electrical, septic siding, floor, gutters or other repairs to help meet safety standards.

service.name: Elder Care and Other Family Mediation
service.description: Helps family members work out a plan around an elder's healthcare, living arrangement, financial situation, communication and more.
service.application_process: Call to speak with a case manager

service.name: Meridian Family Support Center
service.description: Can assist with basic needs such as food, clothing, hygiene supplies and more. Families who would like to visit the clothing closet, which includes clothing for both kids and adults, should call to make an appointment.

service.name: Dominic's Closet
service.description: A non-profit charity to help get medical supplies to those in need. Supplies are free of charge to anyone who needs them. Check the Facebook page frequently for new listings.

service.name: PeaceHealth Primary Care
service.description: Primary care doctors help you stay healthy and prevent illness. Conditions treated include behavioral health issues, chronic illness, developmental delay/disability, minor aches & pains, minor infections, minor injuries, routine illness, and sexual health.

service.name: Our Little Wishes Instrument Loaner Program
service.description: Loans musical instruments to children who wish to participate in their school band or orchestra, but find they are unable to afford the monthly rental cost of an instrument.
service.application_process: Download application online.

service.name: Emergency Child Care Voucher
service.description: Provides short-term emergency assistance to help families pay for high-quality child care in a licensed child care center or licensed family home.

service.name: Wild Things
service.description: Designed for children ages 0-6 and their adult(s). Wild Things is a placed-based community program that visits local parks each month to see what nature has to offer.
service.application_process: Online form available.

service.name: Eating Healthy Program
service.description: Provides scholarships to Whatcom County students from preschool through 8th grade who wish to participate in camps and activities designed to encourage growing and eating organic fruits and vegetables.

service.name: Lummi Community Services
service.description: Provides food and energy assistance to low income households allowing the clients to maintain his or her dignity while applying for services.  Commodity foods, nutrition education, energy assistance, lummi wood cutting, food bank, diapers and clothing, and holiday food baskets.
service.application_process: Call for services.

service.name: Boys and Girls Club Clubhouses
service.description: Before and after school "clubhouse" programs for grades K-12 impact kids positively through academic success, good citizenship, healthy lifestyles, and athletic programs. Athletic programming varies by location.
service.application_process: Applications accepted year round. Member fees due every May and renewals must be completed online.

service.name: Mt. Baker Family Services
service.description: Assists families with resources, information and problem solving to help their children succeed in school.

service.name: Roots of Empathy Program
service.description: Evidence-based classroom program that has shown significant effect in reducing levels of aggression among schoolchildren by raising social/emotional competence and increasing empathy. The program is designed for children ages 5 to 13.
service.application_process: Online form available.

service.name: Computers and Technology Access - BPL
service.description: Bellingham Public Library locations provide public access to computers, and printing and copying equipment (15 cents per black and white page, 50 cents per color page). Visitors with a Bellingham or Whatcom County library card may use a computer with internet access for 90 minutes a day. Visitors without a library card may use a guest pass. Free wireless internet access (WiFi) is available in all library buildings.

service.name: Youth and Peer Mediation
service.description: Assisting youth to resolve a conflict, or facilitate a peer-mediation training.
service.application_process: Online application available

service.name: Bellingham Parks and Recreation
service.description: Supports a healthy community by providing high quality parks and recreation services.

service.name: Brainspotting Therapy - Hope and Thrive Counseling
service.description: Brainspotting is a new type of therapy that can be used for people who have experienced trauma or have PTSD, anxiety, or ADHD, as well as those who struggle with impulse control, sports performance, substance abuse, chronic fatigue or chronic pain.
service.fees: Health insurance, sliding scale fee, and all major forms of payment accepted.

service.name: NWYS Transitional Living Program
service.description: Short-term, supportive housing program for homeless single, couples, or parenting young adults, ages 18-24, to work on tenancy skills and housing qualifications.

service.name: Ferndale Severe Weather Shelter
service.description: Emergency shelter open during severe weather events to provide individuals and families in need with a safe place to sleep, warm food, and referrals to community resources whenever possible. Call or check website to verify open status.

service.name: Unity Care NW Primary and Preventative Health Care
service.description: A full range of primary medical services, including well-child exams, immunizations, annual exams, women’s health care, prescriptions, diagnosis and treatment of acute illness, urgent care, on-site testing and laboratory services, behavioral health care, care of chronic illnesses, reproductive health and contraception, sexually-transmitted disease testing and treatment, and care coordination.
service.fees: Apple Health (Medicaid), Medicare, and private insurance accepted. Sliding Fee Discount Program available based on household size and income.

service.name: Surrender an Animal - WHS
service.description: As an open-admission humane society, WHS will accept any animal regardless of the animals age, breed, temperament, physical or medical condition.

service.name: Higbee Hikers
service.description: A seasonal program offered to Max Higbee members that incorporates outdoor skills such as environmental stewardship, map reading and navigation, plant identification, healthy hiking snacks, and trail games.

service.name: Express Employment Professionals
service.description: Provides a full range of employment solutions that include full-time, temporary, and part-time employment in a wide range of positions, including Professional, Light Industrial, and Office Services.

service.name: Nooksack Valley Food Bank - Sumas
service.description: Provides produce, canned goods, breads, meat, and dairy items. No ID or proof of address required. Income guidelines are currently 400% of Federal Poverty Level.

service.name: Baby Peppers Program
service.description: Program designed for new parents to attend with their baby, aged 5-12 months. Groups come together for 90 minutes, once a week, for 11 weeks  with time for sharing parenting highs and lows, time to focus on the babies' development, and a discussion topics.
service.fees: Sliding scale, flexible pricing. Call for details.

service.name: Spay and Neuter Assistance - AHS
service.description: Voucher program for those in need of financial assistance to spay/neuter their pets.

service.name: Depression Counseling - Hope and Thrive Counseling
service.description: Counseling services for individuals struggling with depression.
service.fees: Health insurance, sliding scale fee, and all major forms of payment accepted.

service.name: Associates in Mental Health Services
service.description: Confidential mental health services for adults, adolescents, children, couples, families, and groups.

service.name: Ideal Option
service.description: Outpatient addiction medicine clinic provides evidence-based treatment for addiction to opioids like fentanyl, heroin, and oxycodone, and stimulants like methamphetamine and cocaine. Medication-assisted treatment for alcohol withdrawal and relapse prevention also available.
service.fees: Medicaid, Medicare, and private insurance accepted. Payment plans offered for those who need it.

service.name: Parent Child Interaction Therapy
service.description: Designed to help both parents and children, PCIT is an intensive treatment program that works with parents and children together to improve the quality of the parent-child relationship and to teach parents the skills necessary to manage their child's severe behavior problems. PCIT is appropriate for children who are between the ages of 2 and 7 and exhibit certain behavioral concerns.
service.application_process: Call for more information, or to find out if you and your child are eligible.

service.name: Other Rental Housing Programs - BHA
service.description: Partnership with several affordable housing properties financed by Bonds and/or Low-Income Housing Tax Credits (LIHTC). Properties are managed by Indigo Real Estate Services. Income limits and other eligibility requirements may vary by property. To find out if you qualify or to learn about availability, you must contact Indigo directly.
service.application_process: All applications are done directly with Indigo by contacting the property you wish to apply for.

service.name: Sea Mar Everson Medical Clinic
service.description: Specializes in primary care family medicine, including preventive health exams, prenatal care, acute care visits, minor procedures, health education, follow-up care from hospital visits, and referrals.

service.name: Sea Mar Maternity Support Services
service.description: Provides support and information related to prenatal and postpartum health. Services include prenatal and postpartum education groups, breastfeeding groups, transportation assistance during pregnancy, hospital tours in English and Spanish, behavioral health counseling, dental care, WIC, and chemical dependency services.

service.name: CenteringPregnancy
service.description: Lydia Place and Moonbelly Midwifery are partnering together to provide a unique blend of trauma-informed, compassionate, professional, midwifery care for pregnant people experiencing homelessness, housing instability, or other life transitions.

service.name: Laundry Love
service.description: Limited supply of laundry vouchers available each week at Opportunity Council. Vouchers are limited to one per person per month, and are distributed on a first come first served basis every Friday, 8 - 9 AM while supplies last. Vouchers can be redeemed at Bellingham Cleaning Center.

service.name: Opportunity Council Community Resource Center
service.description: Connects people with community resources to help meet basic needs such as food and housing.

service.name: Southside Community Meal
service.description: Everyone is invited to the free monthly community meal hosted at Our Savior Lutheran Church on the third Sunday of every month from 5:00 - 6:30 PM. There is no meal in December, as well as in June, July, and August.

service.name: Christian Counseling - Hope and Thrive Counseling
service.description: Faith-based counseling. Open to everyone, including those who have different faiths and worldviews.
service.fees: Health insurance, sliding scale fee, and all major forms of payment accepted.

service.name: Whatcom Civil Rights Project
service.description: Provides legal assistance and advocacy to victims of discrimination and civil rights abuse in Whatcom County.
service.application_process: Call and leave a detailed message with your name, a good contact number and a time at which you can be reached, and a brief description of your question or situation.

service.name: Blaine Family Service Center
service.description: Strengthening families and students by helping them with basic needs and linking them to local resources.
