Resources include basic needs, such as food, clothing and housing; school supplies; energy assistance; GED and ELL classes; family literacy; domestic violence resources; and medicaid enrollment.

service.name: Budget and Credit Counseling - Clearpoint
service.description: A free budget and credit counseling session gives you the opportunity to work with a certified credit counselor and create an action plan for your financial future.

service.name: William Matthews VFW Post 1585
service.description: A place to foster comradeship with veterans and family.

service.name: Ferndale Senior Center
service.description: Provides affordable educational, nutritional, social and recreational programs for Ferndale senior citizens. A place for seniors to gather together for fitness, health and happiness.

service.name: 24:7 Dad Class
service.description: Support groups, events, and meetings for dads to talk with others that are dealing with similar issues at home.
service.application_process: Register online.

service.name: Unity Care NW Adult Dental Care
service.description:
Prioritizes dental care for the following groups: pregnant women, parents of UCNW pediatric patients, established UCNW pediatric dental patients once they reach adulthood, people living with HIV, developmentally disabled patients, adults with dental emergencies, UCNW medical patients with certain health conditions who are referred by their provider.

Emergency dental care is available to anyone living in Whatcom County. If you are in pain or have swelling, call to make an appointment.
service.fees: Apple Health (Medicaid), Medicare, and private insurance accepted. Sliding Fee Discount Program available based on household size and income.

service.name: Swim to Live Program
service.description: Supports children in need who love to swim and wish to participate on a swim team, take swim lessons, or need aquatic therapy.
service.application_process: Download application online.

service.name: CCS Children's Mental Health
service.description: Provides children’s mental health services to Medicaid eligible children and their families. After an initial assessment and determination of need for ongoing help, core mental health services available include individual and/or family counseling/therapy, medication evaluation/management and coordination with primary care physicians, and case management.

service.name: Office of Refugee and Immigrant Assistance
service.description: Services to support refugee and immigrant families and individuals in Washington State. Services include cash, food, and medical benefits; employment and training; naturalization services; health and mental health services; and more.
service.application_process: You can apply for assistance online at washingtonconnection.org, or at your local Community Services Office.

service.name: HSDC Clinic
service.description: Audiology care, hearing aid fittings, in-house speech and language therapy, and much more available at HSDC's Seattle clinic.

service.name: Washington Survivors of Suicide Support Group
service.description: A drop-in virtual support group twice a month for those who have lost a loved one to suicide and reside in Washington State.
service.application_process: For more information, fill out the online form.

service.name: Mental Health Counseling - Clarity MHR
service.description: Counseling services to address acute or chronic conditions that range from depression and anxiety, to complex trauma. Counseling services are also offered for those with co-occurring disorders which may include a combination of group therapy, EMDR, neurofeedback and individual therapy to help clients achieve their goals.

service.name: Bellingham Childcare and Learning Center
service.description: Provides high quality, affordable childcare for children 1 month to 5 years old from families of all income levels. Tuition assistance available, DSHS/TANF assistance accepted.
service.application_process: Apply online to get on waitlist. Waitlist times vary by child's age.
service.wait_time: Waitlist times vary by child's age
service.fees: Tuition Assistance available, DSHS payments accepted

service.name: Mental Health Outpatient Services - Lifeline Connections
service.description: Comprehensive mental health services including therapy, case management and other support services.

service.name: Deaf 101
service.description: Tips and strategies for interacting with Deaf and hard of hearing people in an accessible way.

service.name: Bellingham Health Center - Planned Parenthood
service.description: Services include abortion, birth control, HIV services, men's health care, emergency contraception, pregnancy testing and services, primary care, women's health care, and  STD testing, treatment and vaccines.

service.name: L&I Workers' Rights
service.description: Workers are protected by laws and rules covering workers' wages, working conditions, overtime pay, and prevailing wage on public works construction projects. Resources include information about understanding worker rights and benefits, filing a workplace complaint, termination and retaliation, minimum wage, paid sick leave, and more.

service.name: Social Security Disability Insurance (SSDI)
service.description: Provides assistance to people who meet requirements for disability. SSDI pays benefits to you and certain family members if you are “insured.” This means that you worked long enough – and recently enough - and paid Social Security taxes on your earnings.
service.application_process: Apply online, by phone, or in person.

service.name: Buddy Break
service.description: A free Parents’ Day Out/respite program where kids with all types of special needs have fun while their caregivers get a break. Participants and their siblings have opportunities to make new friends, play games, do crafts, hear children’s stories, enjoy music, and more, while their parents get a break from their ongoing care-giving responsibilities. Call for schedule.
service.application_process: Contact church for dates.

service.name: Financial Empowerment Courses
service.description: Free financial empowerment courses cover financial goals, budgeting, debt management, and more. Classes are in-person and available year-round in both English and Spanish, with specialized courses for teens and seniors.
service.application_process: Email to register for classes. Class locations and times vary throughout the year.

service.name: CAP Winter Coat Drive
service.description: Annual drive and distribution of winter coats, hats, gloves, and socks for men, women, and children living in Blaine, Birch Bay, and Custer. Distribution typically takes place in late Autumn.

service.name: Frank Haskell Eye Clinic
service.description: Free eye examinations and glasses for qualified low-income persons who complete an application and can meet the income requirements. Open the first and third Thursday of each month by appointment.
service.application_process: Download an application online, return completed application forms to the clinic.

service.name: Detention and Deportation Defense - NWIRP
service.description: NWIRP takes on a variety of cases, representing people who are recent arrivals to the United States as well as those who have been in the country for many years.

service.name: Gotcha Covered
service.description: Program to help Whatcom Dream Financial Empowerment Course Graduates purchase school clothing and supplies for their children. Participants can purchase a $100 gift card for only $25. Proceeds go into a scholarship fund, which allows Whatcom Dream to offer Financial Empowerment courses for free.
service.application_process: Inquire online.

service.name: IRIS
service.description: Connects immigrants with needed resources, and provides funding for items and services that are not accessible to this marginalized population.

service.name: StrongHearts Native Helpline
service.description: A 24/7 confidential and anonymous culturally-appropriate domestic and sexual violence helpline for Native Americans. Advocates can provide peer support and advocacy, information and education about domestic violence and sexual violence, personalized safety planning, crisis intervention, referrals to Native-centered domestic violence and sexual violence service providers, and more.

service.name: Parent Coalition
service.description: Families that need support with services and resources meet with a trained Parent Advocate to formulate a strategy to obtain services tailored to the needs of their family member. These needs may include special education services, future planning for adult services such as guardianship, government assistance such as Medicaid, or conflict resolution regarding standards of care.

service.name: Alateen
service.description: A part of the Al-Anon Family Groups’ fellowship for younger members whose lives have been affected by someone else’s drinking. At Alateen Meetings, younger members meet other Alateens with similar situations. Alateen is not a religious program and there are no fees or dues to belong to it. Find a meeting close to you using the online search tool.

service.name: WDRC Facilitation Services
service.description: Designs and facilitates small and large group processes. Groups and organizations use facilitation services to guide meetings in which emotions may run high or important decisions need to be made.
service.application_process: Call to get started

service.name: Base Camp
service.description: Overnight shelter and day center for adults ages 18 and older. Pets welcome. Nightly check-in begins at 7pm. Free breakfast (7:15am), lunch (12pm), and dinner (4:30pm) served daily. Other services for guests include showers, public restrooms, and laundry services.

service.name: Sea Mar Bellingham Behavioral Health Child and Family Services
service.description: A state-licensed community mental health agency focused on children and families. Services include mental health assessments, individual and family therapy, group therapy, case management, advocacy, and school-based programs.

service.name: Bellingham Family Resource Centers
service.description: Family support centers that link school families with local resources and human services addressing the needs of the whole child in order to promote student success. All families are welcome to visit the site nearest to them (Shuksan Middle School or Carl Cozier Elementary School).

service.name: WDRC Mediation Services
service.description: A voluntary, confidential, and affordable process for resolving conflict with the help of a neutral, trained professional. Mediation is offered for a range of disputes, including divorce issues (property and financial), parenting plan creation or modification, parent/teen, other family issues (elder care, estates, etc.), co-worker and workplace issues, business/consumer, foreclosure, small claims, neighborhood issues, landlord/tenant, anti-harassment, intercultural, victim/offender, and more.

service.name: New Way Home Program
service.description: A faith-based transitional living facility for homeless women and children who may be struggling from addiction, domestic violence, human trafficking, or a crisis pregnancy. Services include safe clean rooms and warm beds, 24 hour support staff, services for pregnant women, weekly case management, life skills classes, access to community resources, help with finding permanent housing, options for employment and continuing education, and more.
service.application_process: Call to apply for waiting list.

service.name: Parenting Seminars - Parenting Academy
service.description: 60-minute virtual seminars focus on a range of topics for parents and everyday parenting.
service.application_process: Call or apply online.

service.name: Enrichment Scholarship Program
service.description: Provides summer scholarships to middle and high school public school students in Whatcom County. Students may apply for summer enrichment camps in a variety of areas such as music, science, art, debate, technology, dance, leadership and many others.
service.application_process: Students must complete an application (available online or from school counselors), write an essay, submit a letter of recommendation, and provide a parent/guardian signature.

service.name: English for Speakers of Other Languages (ESOL) Classes  - Goodwill
service.description: ESOL classes offered at basic and intermediate levels for people who want to develop basic English literacy and improve language skills for the workplace. Classes include ESOL Basic through Level 4, and Citizenship Test Preparation. Classes are held two days a week for 2 hours.
service.application_process: Call or register online.

service.name: New Way Next Steps Program
service.description: A one-year extended plan for residents who have completed and graduated from the six-month New Way Home Program. The resident moves into a subsidized apartment at New Way Ministries and pays reduced rent.

service.name: Y's Buys Thrift Boutique
service.description: A place to shop and to donate quality new and used women’s clothing. Clothing vouchers provided for women in need. Back to Work Vouchers also available, good for 3 fully styled outfits for interviews or work. Call or visit the YWCA office to inquire about vouchers for yourself or for your organization.

service.name: Investigation and Prosecution Services - Dawson Place
service.description: Every service needed to investigate and prosecute a case involving a child victim of physical abuse, sexual abuse, and neglect is available at Dawson Place.
service.application_process: Call for information

service.name: Treatment Facilities Program
service.description: Advocates for effective, humane, and therapeutic treatment in institutional settings. Facilities may include hospitals, assisted living facilities, nursing facilities, Residential Habilitation Centers, enhanced services facilities, and immigration detention facilities.

service.name: National Sexual Assault Hotline
service.description: Call to access a range of free services including confidential support from a trained staff member, support finding a local health facility with services like sexual assault forensic exams, someone to help you talk through what happened, local resources that can assist with your next steps toward healing and recovery, referrals for long term support in your area, information about the laws in your community, and basic information about medical concerns.

service.name: Children and Teens Counseling - Hope and Thrive Counseling
service.description: Counseling services available to children and teens.
service.fees: Health insurance, sliding scale fee, and all major forms of payment accepted.

service.name: Community Case Management - LWC
service.description: Supports clients with chronic mental illness to develop skills to manage their symptoms and assists them to access a full range of services in the community. The program's intensity is continually adjusted to address the full spectrum of treatment, from crisis intervention to independence of case management.
service.application_process: Fill out the Outpatient Services Paperwork available online, return paperwork to Lake Whatcom Center.

service.name: Ascent Program
service.description: Faith-based relapse prevention program for homeless men with substance use and other self-destructive behaviors.  In addition to shelter and relapse prevention, services include one-on-one case management, connections to resources, life skills classes, work therapy, behavioral health referrals, and more.
service.application_process: Men can be screened for the program by meeting with an Intake Case Manager at Base Camp. Call for more information.

service.name: Nooksack Indian Health Department
service.description: An innovative ambulatory health care center that serves members of the Nooksack Indian Tribe and the Tribal Member community. Also provides community health prevention and education services to ensure patients receive health care to the fullest extent including, Medical, Dental, Community Health/Health Nursing, Mental Health Counseling, Chemical Dependency Counseling, Chemical Dependency Prevention and Contract Health Services.

service.name: Child Abuse Hotline
service.description: Hotline to report child abuse or neglect to Child Protective Services.

service.name: Early Support for Infants and Toddlers - Opportunity Council
service.description: Serves families with children from birth to three years old who have developmental delays or disabilities in order to maximize each child’s development.

service.name: PeaceHealth Nutrition Services
service.description: Registered dietitians are available to help you learn about nutrition and how to eat better, and nutritional counseling can give you tools to help you improve your diet. Conditions treated include child development conditions, diabetes (type 1, type 2, and gestational), food allergies & sensitivities, heart attack, liver/pancreas/biliary cancers, obesity, thyroid disorders, vascular disease, and women's health issues.

service.name: Homebuyer Support - WHRC
service.description: Contact a specialist by phone for pre-purchase housing counseling, homebuyer education classes, down-payment assistance programs, and alternative homeownership models such as community land trusts and self-help homeownership.

service.name: FACES Northwest Summer Program
service.description: 8-week therapeutic recreational summer day program for school aged children through young adults with autism. Provides community involvement, independent living skills, academic enrichment and positive social relationships.

service.name: Citizenship - NWIRP
service.description: Helps immigrants obtain United States Citizenship. NWIRP ensures that people with disabilities can attain U.S. citizenship, fights wrongful citizenship denials, represents people with criminal records who are still eligible for U.S. citizenship, and defends U.S. citizens who have been wrongfully placed in removal proceedings.

service.name: 988 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline
service.description: Provides 24/7, free and confidential support for people in distress, prevention and crisis resources for them or their loved ones, and best practices for professionals in the United States.
service.interpretation_services: Sign Language (in-person or video), Telephone-Based Interpreter Services

service.name: Developmental Preschool - MSD
service.description: Early childhood preschool programs provide a language-based curriculum to students ages 3-4 who have been identified with developmental delays and qualify for special education services. Programs provide direct, integrated, and/or consultative services to students with mild to moderate disabilities in general education. Contact your school district to apply.

service.name: Missing Persons Information
service.description: Website containing relevant information concerning persons reported missing in the State of Washington.

service.name: Our Treehouse Young Adult Night
service.description: A peer-support group for young adults to explore their feelings through facilitator led conversations and creative processes.
service.application_process: Contact to apply.

service.name: Mobile Animals as Natural Therapy
service.description: Therapeutic animal visits for elders, schools, community & corporate events. Provides a unique opportunity for a multitude of community members to experience the joy & therapeutic benefits of animal interaction with horses, miniature horse, miniature mule, goats, dogs, chickens, & rabbits.
service.application_process: Contact for quote and to schedule.

service.name: Kinship Care
service.description: Offers support services for grandparents or other non-parental caregivers of children in their custody in Whatcom, Island and San Juan County.

service.name: Drug and Alcohol Assessments - Contact Counseling
service.description: The purpose of an assessment is to help determine if an individual has a substance use disorder. During the assessment, the counselor will discuss personal history, family, and relationship with alcohol and other drugs. The counselor will also work with you to determine an appropriate recommendation.
service.application_process: Visit the office to sign up in person, or use the online contact form

service.name: Bellingham Playbook
service.description: Your guide to recreation and educational opportunities in Bellingham. The new Playbook (formerly known as the Leisure guide) provides a complete listing of recreation activities available throughout Bellingham.

service.name: BTC Childbirth and Parenting Education
service.description: Education program designed to educate and support individuals in their role as parents or caretakers of children. The program incorporates positive parenting skills with a child development knowledge base that promotes strong and healthy families.
service.application_process: Application to BTC required

service.name: Kids in Motion Occupational Therapy
service.description: Pediatric Occupational Therapists (OTs) are practitioners who deliver skilled occupational therapy services to children. They help children participate in their daily occupations, or everyday activities including anything from being able to ride the school bus to getting ready for bed at night.
service.application_process: Call to apply for services. There is a waitlist for services, wait times vary by service type.

service.name: Mending Babyloss Remembrance Ceremony
service.description: Annual remembrance ceremony takes place in October for anyone who has experienced pregnancy or infant loss of any kind.

service.name: Simple Wills Clinic
service.description: Clinic for residents of Whatcom County who are seniors, people with disabilities, and/or people with terminal illnesses who require assistance with simple will documents or need referral to a pro bono attorney.
service.application_process: Call for more information.

service.name: Home Rehabilitation Loan Program
service.description: Low-interest loans for the rehabilitation of residences occupied by owner households with incomes at or below 80% of the median income of Whatcom County. Additional services include inspection to determine needed repairs, assistance in construction oversight, referrals to other agencies for social services beneficial to low- and moderate-income households, and more.
service.application_process: Call for information.

service.name: Kids Korner Toddler Program
service.description: Fulltime curriculum-based childcare program that includes three toddler classrooms separated based on age groups (1-2yrs, 2-2.5yrs, 2.5-3yrs). This program accepts Working Connections Child Care.
service.application_process: Call or email to register.
service.fees: Monthly rates based on child's age and amount of days spent at center

service.name: Division of Vocational Rehabilitation (DVR)
service.description: A statewide resource assisting people with disabilities to prepare for, secure, maintain, advance in, or regain employment. DVR serves people who seek meaningful, secure employment but whose disabilities may result in one or more barriers to achieving an employment goal.
service.application_process: Contact DSHS by phone or at your local Community Services Office for application.

service.name: Alternative Response Team (ART)
service.description: A Bellingham program that sends a behavioral health specialist and a public health nurse to respond to specific non-violent behavioral health 911 calls. The Alternative Response Team (ART) is an innovative program that benefits people having mental or behavioral health challenges, and our police personnel, allowing them to respond to other emergent calls requiring law enforcement intervention.

service.name: Blaine Clothing Bank
service.description: Provides free clothing and household linens to residents of Blaine, Birch Bay, and Custer.

service.name: Washington Survivors of Suicide Care Package
service.description: A care package for those who are recently bereaved by a suicide. Included in this package are materials on grief after a suicide as well as comfort items found to be helpful by other survivors of suicide loss. These care packages are currently available for free to families living in Washington State.
service.application_process: To request a package for yourself or a loved one, fill out the online form.

service.name: AES Inc.
service.description: Help finding temporary or long term work. Skill assessment and job-matching tools lead to job opportunities that match applicants' abilities and interests, and higher degrees of success and job satisfaction.

service.name: VA Advice Nurse
service.description: Veterans can call an advice nurse any time of day with questions about their care or for help in deciding whether an urgent or routine appointment is needed.

service.name: SHIBA
service.description: SHIBA (Statewide Health Insurance Benefits Advisors) is a free, confidential, and impartial Medicare counseling resource. Volunteer SHIBA advisors are highly experienced in counseling Medicare-eligible residents of all ages and backgrounds, trained to help you understand your rights and options by offering up-to-date information so you can make informed decisions related to your health insurance needs.

service.name: L&I Workers' Compensation
service.description: If you are injured at work or develop a work-related illness, workers' compensation pays for medical care directly related to your accident or illness.

service.name: Sunrise Home Care Services
service.description: Maximizing independence and comfort for seniors and persons with disabilities by meeting your needs at home. In-home services include housework and laundry, bathing and personal hygiene, toileting, eating and/or meal preparation, dressing, body care, transferring, ambulation, self-medication, supervision, shopping essentials, travel to medical services, and more.
service.fees: Private pay accepted. If eligible, Medicaid Personal Care, COPES, or In-Home Respite accepted.

service.name: Community Outreach and Recovery Support Team (CORS)
service.description: A specialty program that works with adults in the community who need extra assistance to engage with treatment services and stabilize their housing situation. The team consists of a mix of Peer Counselors and Clinicians, who work in the community to outreach to individuals who would benefit from more intensive treatment services.
service.application_process: Fill out a General Inquiries form online. If you are already a Compass Health client, speak with your clinician.

service.name: Washington State Homeowner Assistance Fund
service.description: Foreclosure prevention assistance funds to help homeowners who have experienced economic hardship as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic.
service.application_process: Call the WHRC hotline to apply.

service.name: WWU Counseling Training Clinic
service.description: Free counseling services for adults, adolescents, and children. Services are provided by graduate students in training, closely supervised by faculty of the Psychology Department.
service.fees: Services are free, no insurance required.

service.name: Ferndale Other Bank
service.description: Offers hygiene articles to low-income families and individuals. Qualifying families can drop in once a month on Tuesday mornings or Thursday afternoons to receive free items including toilet paper, bar soap, laundry detergent, shampoo, toothbrushes and toothpaste, menstrual pads and tampons, deodorant, razors, diapers and adult incontinence supplies.
service.application_process: Visit the Resource Center to apply.

service.name: Salvation Army Energy Assistance
service.description: Help paying a PSE bill for people who have an urgent and/or shut off notice. Appointment with Opportunity Council Energy Assistance needs to be scheduled first (temporary assistance in the event appointment is scheduled far out).

service.name: Child Find Screenings - FSD
service.description: A screening to identify any factors that may interfere with a child’s learning, growth and development. The screening is also provided to help parents identify their child’s strengths and weaknesses and provide home suggestions and/or further evaluation if needed in any area of concern. Any child, birth to five, whose family or care givers would like more information about their child’s development can contact their local school district to receive a free Child Find Screening.
service.application_process: Call or email for more information and to schedule a screening.

service.name: Cascade Connections Vocational Services
service.description: Works with Whatcom County businesses to provide employment services to people with disabilities in our community. Services include help with getting and keeping a job, job coaching and on-site support, goal setting and career consulting, resume writing and interviewing skills practice, and empowerment and advocacy.

service.name: Warm Home Fund
service.description: Can help with with Puget Sound Energy bills that have a status of Urgent, Final, or Disconnect for residents of Blaine, Birch Bay, Custer, Everson, Nooksack, Point Roberts, Sumas, or Lynden.
service.application_process: Call or email to set up an appointment.

service.name: The Christmas Shoppe
service.description: Annual program available for graduates of Whatcom Dream's Financial Empowerment courses. Participants can shop for brand new toys and gifts at a 75% to 90% discount from the retail price.
service.application_process: Email or call for more information.

service.name: Teen Court
service.description: School-based program that offers all participants, student advocates as well as respondents, the opportunity to learn about the consequences of criminal behavior and how it affects their community. Teen Court is a diversion program, with the goal of offering youth an alternative to juvenile detention.
service.application_process: This program is accessed through referrals by the Prosecutor's Office.

service.name: Ferndale Jump Start Kindergarten
service.description: A free transitional kindergarten for students who are scheduled to enter kindergarten in the upcoming fall. Students enter the Jump Start program based on need and/or ability such as financial, social emotional, academics, and /or transportation needs. Students must be 4 years old prior to August 31 to be eligible for the current school year. Students cannot be enrolled in another early learning program.
service.application_process: Call or email to apply, or fill out the application online.

service.name: Adoption Support Program
service.description: Assists in removing barriers for families adopting special needs children by providing financial, medical, and counseling support to families who adopt from Washington State.
service.application_process: Apply through your adoption caseworker, or apply directly to the program if there is no assigned caseworker.

service.name: Homeless / Unsheltered Legal Outreach
service.description: Call Opportunity Council's Homeless Outreach Team to get connected to services.

service.name: Lydia Place Mental Health Program
service.description: Provides high quality, low barrier and flexible, clinical mental health services for Lydia Place housing clients.

service.name: PAVE
service.description: Online library of resources that provide support, training, and information to empower and give voice to individuals, youth and families impacted by disabilities.

service.name: Nutrition Classes - A Watered Garden
service.description: Families enjoy nutrition classes and sharing recipes with each other. $25 enrollment fee covers cost of materials. Cookbook included.
service.application_process: Download an application online. Return by email, or mail to AWGFLC PO Box 218, Everson, WA 98247.

service.name: HEART - LWC
service.alternate_name: Holistic Engagement through Allied Recovery & Treatment
service.description: A 24/7 intensive community outreach that provides crisis intervention/prevention and recovery stabilization services to adults in a community. Through non-emergent recovery stabilization, outreach services are provided to individuals at risk of, or who have recently experienced a behavioral health crisis.

service.name: CAP Crisis Assistance
service.description: Provides assistance to residents of Blaine, Birch Bay, Custer, and Point Roberts who have short-term emergency needs for financial assistance, including utility bills (shut-off impending), critical prescription needs, grocery vouchers (when other food assistance is not available), short-term emergency lodging (1-3 day motel stays), and emergency gasoline assistance.
service.application_process: Call to set up an appointment.

service.name: CAP Thanksgiving Baskets
service.description: Provides ready-to-cook turkey dinners for families with limited financial resources living in Blaine, Birch Bay, Custer, and Point Roberts. Each basket is sized to the number of people in the family. Pre-registration is required, and typically takes place October through early November.

service.name: PEPS Single Parents Program
service.description: This pilot peer-support program is offered as a 9-week series, and meets virtually. Each week focuses on a different topic for discussion, and discussion prompts are shared weekly with participants responding at their convenience.

service.name: Tribal Outreach Program - NWRC
service.description: Provides outreach, information, Kinship Care training, telephone reassurance, and friendly visiting to Elders in Lummi, Nooksack, Samish, Sauk-Suiattle, Swinomish, and Upper Skagit tribal communities

service.name: Bellingham Community Meal
service.description: Provides a hearty meal for the community the last Saturday of the month, January through October.

service.name: Ride Help Network
service.description: The Ride Help Network is not currently in operation. Check the website for updates.
service.application_process: Submit a “Request a Ride” form online.

service.name: Community Health and Supportive Services (Answers Counseling)
service.description: Eligible families can receive assistance with employment and housing, benefit navigation and application assistance, affordable Internet connectivity, and more.

service.name: Ferndale Food Bank
service.description: Provides food and support to all community members in need. Individuals and families can visit once a week for as long as assistance is needed.

service.name: Foreclosure Prevention - WHRC
service.description: Homeowners facing foreclosure can contact a specialist by phone for help understanding their rights, accessing resources and tools, and connecting to advocates that provide hands on help.

service.name: Tl’ils Ta’á’altha Victims of Crime Program
service.description: A wellness and strength based advocacy program for Nooksack community members who have suffered domestic violence, sexual assault, stalking, and/or elder abuse. If you or someone you know is experiencing domestic violence, sexual assault, or elder abuse contact the 24-hour phone line.

service.name: U.S. Citizenship Class - A Watered Garden
service.description: Future U.S. Citizens can prepare for the “test” in a safe and trusting environment. Citizenship application help is free.
service.application_process: Download an application online. Return by email, or mail to AWGFLC PO Box 218, Everson, WA 98247.

service.name: WA Hands and Voices Family Toolkit
service.description: Resources to help support families with children who are Deaf or Hard of Hearing (DHH).

service.name: Affordable Connectivity Program (ACP)
service.description: A U.S. government program to help low-income households pay for internet service and connected devices like a laptop or tablet. If your household is eligible, you could receive up to a $30/month discount on your internet service, up to a $75/month discount if your household is on qualifying Tribal lands, and a one-time discount of up to $100 for a laptop, tablet, or desktop computer.
service.application_process: Apply online, by mail, or by contacting the participating internet provider of your choice.

service.name: We Care
service.description: Provides used clothing, furniture, and household items priced as low as possible. On your first visit, purchase your reusable bag for $5-$10 each.  Once you own a bag, fill up with clothing each visit for a very low cost.

service.name: Skookum Mentors
service.description: A program where foster children are paired with a safe adult for one-on-one mentoring.  Mentors are trained and background checked case aides who are equipped to provide social, academic and recreational support for your child and your family.
service.application_process: Submit the mentor request form online.

service.name: Outreach Services - BPL
service.description: Bellingham Public Library provides Outreach services to Bellingham residents who, because of age, illness, or long-term disability of three months or more, are unable to visit the library in person. Individuals who are confined to their homes may arrange to have a family member, volunteer, or caregiver pick up and deliver pre-selected library materials to them. Monthly service is scheduled at various Assisted Living / Health Care facilities in Bellingham.

service.name: Veterans Crisis Line
service.description: Connects Veterans in crisis and their families and friends with qualified, caring Department of Veterans Affairs responders through a confidential toll-free hotline, online chat, or text. Veterans and their loved ones can dial 988 and then Press 1, chat online, or send a text message to 838255 to receive confidential support. Support for deaf and hard of hearing individuals is available.

service.name: Seeds of Empathy Program
service.description: Designed for Early Learning and Child Care settings to foster empathy, social and emotional competence and early literacy skills for children aged 3 to 5 years.
service.application_process: Online form available.

service.name: Second WakeUp House
service.description: Faith-based clean and sober housing for men.
service.application_process: Download application online.

service.name: Compass Health Children’s Intensive Outpatient Treatment
service.description: Comprehensive behavioral health services and supports for Medicaid-eligible individuals up to 20 years of age with complex behavioral health needs. Services include assessment, treatment, and support services.
service.application_process: Request a referral by calling the centralized WISe referral line or fill out online application.

service.name: Lummi Children's Services
service.description: Provides a continuum of culturally relevant support services to children and families of the Lummi Nation in the area of foster care, alternative parental care, and intervention/prevention.
service.application_process: Call for services.

service.name: St. Paul's Alms Ministry
service.description: Can provide a small amount of emergency financial assistance and referrals to other agencies. Text a photo of your ID and your request for assistance, or visit the Alms Ministry desk at Hope House before 10:00 A.M. on Tuesdays.

service.name: Basic Computer Skills - A Watered Garden
service.description: Students gain knowledge needed for word processing, data entry, resume writing, internet job and information searches.
service.application_process: Download an application online. Return by email, or mail to AWGFLC PO Box 218, Everson, WA 98247.

service.name: Homeownership Program - Kulshan CLT
service.description: See website for homeowner loan eligibility criteria and application. If eligible, with a CLT loan, there are no mortgage insurance payments, no balloon payments, no short terms, no fluctuating interest rates–only 30-year fixed-rate conventional mortgages.
service.application_process: Must read eligibility criteria and submit application online to get on waiting list.

service.name: Severe Weather Shelter Information Hotline
service.description: Call the Severe Weather Shelter Information Hotline for the most up to date emergency shelter information.

service.name: Health Home Support Services
service.description: Improving quality of life by coordinating health and social services. Services include comprehensive care management, care coordination and health promotion, transition planning, individual and family support, referral to relevant community and social support services, and health education.

service.name: Grief Recovery Support Groups
service.description: Find a local grief recovery support group.
service.application_process: Register online.

service.name: WCEL Friends Playgroup
service.description: A parent-child program for children ages 18 months to 3 years who are receiving Early Intervention Services at Whatcom Center for Early Learning. These playgroups provide socialization and play opportunities for children and their caregivers.

service.name: Autism Counseling - Hope and Thrive Counseling
service.description: Counseling for individuals with developmental delays is meant to help your loved one understand social elements in simple ways and apply them to their daily life.
service.fees: Health insurance, sliding scale fee, and all major forms of payment accepted.

service.name: Native Fitness
service.description: Texting service for Native youth to receive motivational reminders for fitness, and wellness.
service.application_process: Register online to subscribe.
service.fees: Standard text messaging rates may apply.

service.name: Friendship Community Garden
service.description: Residents from the greater Ferndale community can rent plots for a low cost and grow their own food. Plots rent for $20 for the season plus a $10 refundable cleaning deposit. Scholarships are available for those who need assistance with the cost.

service.name: Dads/Men's Support Group
service.description: A peer support group for anyone who identifies as a dad to come together and connect through their experiences being a parent.
service.application_process: Email for inquiry.

service.name: Roots Family Enrichment Program
service.description: A free parenting program that runs for eight weeks, four quarters per year. The program is specifically designed for families facing challenging life circumstances who desire to develop family-building skills. Parenting classes are held one evening per week in Bellingham, and include a hot meal, nursery care for children ages 4 and under, and Kids Groups for elementary and middle school aged children facing complex life challenges.
service.application_process: Download a registration form online and email to ally@reboundfamilies.org.

service.name: Lummi Tribal Dental Clinic
service.description: Dental care for Lummi Tribal Members, and other American Indian/Alaska Natives.

service.name: RE Store
service.description: Retail location intended to divert as much reusable material as possible from the landfill and to build a culture of reuse in our community by providing salvaged and reclaimed building materials, vintage decor, and a place for community members to donate lightly used items.

service.name: English Language Learner Program - WLC
service.description: Offers free one-to-one tutoring services for adult English language learners. Services include support for English reading, writing, listening, and speaking skills; GED (General Educational Development) test preparation; and basic computer skills.

service.name: Needs Based Ferry Passes
service.description: Discounted ferry tickets for eligible Lummi Island residents. Call for an appointment.
service.application_process: Call to schedule an appointment. Application will require proof of identity, proof of Lummi Island residency, and proof of income.

service.name: Project Hope Food Bank
service.description: Provides food to residents living within the Lynden School District zone. Bring proof of address on your first visit (a piece of mail, utility bill, rent receipt, etc.).

service.name: Couples Counseling - TouchStone
service.description: Licensed counselors help couples discuss their relationship problems.  These could be issues such as repetitive arguments; feelings of emptiness, isolation, anger or resentment; lack of affection or intimacy; infidelity; or pornography addiction.
service.fees: All insurance providers accepted, sliding scale available if no insurance.

service.name: CCS Home Care
service.description: Non-medical assistance for aging persons and those with disabilities living in their homes. Homecare workers do everything from housework (grocery shopping, laundry, dishes, etc.) to personal care (dressing, bathing, transferring, etc.). For all income levels, CCS brings affordable, personal care every day, sustaining those who are served with dignity in the home they cherish.
service.application_process: Complete the online application
service.fees: Many people qualify for free or reduced-cost services through DSHS. Many insurance companies cover this type of care.

service.name: Internet Essentials from Comcast
service.description: Provides affordable home Internet for qualifying households as well as low-cost computers, free WiFi hotspots, and free Internet training. Sign up for Internet Essentials for $9.95/month with no annual contract and free equipment, then enroll in the Affordable Connectivity Program (ACP) to get your service for free.
service.application_process: Apply online or by phone.

service.name: Sunrise Services Adult Family Homes
service.description: Residential supports for adults offered in a comfortable, home atmosphere. All homes are open to any individual, including those with mental, physical and cognitive disabilities.

service.name: McKinney-Vento Program - FSD
service.description: Serves students experiencing homelessness. This program is designed to reduce isolation, maximize stability and maintain consistency for this population of children and youth. Contact the liaison in your school district for support.

service.name: Basic Food Outreach
service.description: Provides information and direct application support that can help families and individuals obtain and maintain SNAP food benefits.
service.application_process: Call or visit the Community Resource Center for application assistance.

service.name: Mt. Baker Educational Resource Center
service.description: A public preschool program that includes Head Start, Co-Op Preschool, and Child Find Screenings.

service.name: Kids Korner Preschool Program
service.description: Fulltime curriculum-based childcare program for children 3-5 yrs old. This program accepts Working Connections Child Care.
service.application_process: Call or email to register.
service.fees: Monthly rates are based on child's age and amount of days spent at center

service.name: Guide By Your Side
service.description: Unbiased emotional support and resources provided by trained Parent Guides to families with children with hearing loss.
service.application_process: Request support online, or call for more information
service.interpretation_services: Spanish Language, Sign Language (in-person or video), Telephone-Based Interpreter Services

service.name: Kids in Motion Speech Therapy
service.description: Pediatric Speech Language Pathologists (SLPs) are practitioners who deliver skilled speech therapy services to children. They work to prevent, assess, diagnose, and treat speech, language, social communication, cognitive-communication, and swallowing disorders.
service.application_process: Call to apply for services. There is a waitlist for services, wait times vary by service type.

service.name: Child Care Nutrition Program
service.description: Reimburses licensed/participating family child care providers for the nutritious meals they serve to the children in their care.

service.name: Wild Whatcom Ladies Night Out
service.description: For female-identifying and non binary people ages 18+ to get outdoors and explore nature under the full moon, with other adults.
service.application_process: Online form available.

service.name: WHS Thrift Shop
service.description: Proceeds from purchases at the WHS Thrift Shop benefit daily operations and care for the domestic, wild and farm animals in our shelters.

service.name: Conversational Spanish Classes - A Watered Garden
service.description: Native English speakers can cultivate new language skills through conversational Spanish classes.
service.application_process: Download an application online. Return by email, or mail to AWGFLC PO Box 218, Everson, WA 98247.

service.name: weRnative.org
service.description: Interactive website for Native youth. Topics include culture, health, relationships, mental health, making an impact, and more.

service.name: Women's Empowerment Conference
service.description: This virtual workshop series offers all women opportunities to connect, learn new skills, and feel empowered on your journey to fulfilling your goals, dreams, and purpose.

service.name: Sea Mar Healthcare for the Homeless Program
service.description: Primary health care services such as medical, preventive health and dental, substance abuse treatment and counseling, and mental health services for individuals who are experiencing homelessness, including migrant and seasonal farmworkers.

service.name: Nooksack House of Children Head Start
service.description: A comprehensive preschool program for children ages 3 to 5 from income eligible families. This program provides children and families with information and access to child health and development, nutrition, behavioral health, family goal setting and resources.
service.application_process: Complete the Initial Application Form online

service.name: Non-Emergency Medical Transportation - NWRC
service.description: Free non-emergency medical transportation for Medicaid eligible recipients. At least two full business days' notice required. Assistance for bus passes and gas vouchers also available.
service.application_process: Call at least two business days before your appointment to request a ride.

service.name: Project Hope Community Assistance
service.description: Helps Lynden community members with short-term, emergency assistance which may include utilities, rent, clothing, household goods, laundry, and fuel. Call to set up an appointment.
service.application_process: Call or email to set up an appointment.

service.name: Financial Literacy and Renters Education
service.description: A free series of classes designed to increase knowledge and skills in budgeting, credit, debt, landlord/tenant law and savings.
service.application_process: Register in advance online to participate in an upcoming session.

service.name: Children and Youth  - NWIRP
service.description: Guarantees access to life-altering forms of immigration relief to children and youth who have been abandoned, abused or neglected by their parents.

service.name: CAP Chaplain Ministry
service.description: CAP chaplains offer non-judgmental listening, emotional and spiritual support, and help assessing needs and making connections with community resources. Call to make an appointment.

service.name: Perinatal Counseling - Hope and Thrive Counseling
service.description: Postpartum Counseling is intended to help new moms find the support they need to adjust to all the challenges that come with adding a new baby to a family.
service.fees: Health insurance, sliding scale fee, and all major forms of payment accepted.

service.name: Law Enforcement Assisted Diversion (LEAD)
service.description: A community-based effort to find solutions for individuals who are high utilizers of criminal justice systems. The aim is to lead people out of the criminal justice system and into intensive case management where those who are dealing with behavioral health issues can have their needs met appropriately.

service.name: MAD HOPE
service.alternate_name: Making A Difference - Helping Other People Everywhere
service.description: Youth suicide prevention program with trainings designed by youth and the community. Training is based on current suicide prevention research, and aims to open up a conversation about suicide, help combat stigma surrounding mental illnesses and suicide, and help others learn how to identify and intervene with a loved one.

service.name: Office of the Developmental Disabilities Ombuds (DD Ombuds)
service.description: Operates statewide to investigate, advocate, and report on services to people with developmental disabilities. The program provides a range of services, including monitoring, information on rights and responsibilities, informal advocacy, and recommendations for changes in policy and procedures.

service.name: Small Group Classes - WLC
service.description: Classes for adults to work together to study reading, writing, and speaking in English. Classes include Talk Time (practicing English conversation), preparing for the GED (General Education Diploma), citizenship test preparation, learning and improving basic computer skills, and open computer lab for learning how to use online educational resources. Find the current class schedule online.

service.name: Supplemental Security Income (SSI)
service.description: Provides monthly payments to adults and children with a disability or blindness who have income and resources below specific financial limits. SSI payments are also made to people age 65 and older without disabilities who meet the financial qualifications.
service.application_process: Apply online, by phone, or in person.

service.name: Promise Kindergarten
service.description: A free, full day early entrance kindergarten for children who are scheduled to enter kindergarten in the upcoming fall. The program focuses on basic academic and social skills to help qualifying students get a jump start towards success in school. Students must demonstrate financial, academic and social-emotional needs and cannot be currently enrolled in another early learning program.
service.application_process: Use the online form to apply.

service.name: Dental Education in the Care of Persons with Disabilities (DECOD) Clinic
service.description: Provides dental care that is not otherwise available in the community for patients with developmental and acquired disabilities. Adults with DDA Medicaid benefits are usually eligible for DECOD services. Other individuals may be eligible if they meet state requirements.
service.application_process: Download and complete the DECOD Application Packet.

service.name: Military Reconnect - Clearpoint
service.description: When soldiers return home it can be difficult to truly reconnect with relationships and establish themselves financially. This program is geared toward helping members of the military and veterans re-establish themselves and achieve financial stability.

service.name: Basic Needs Program - PREPARES
service.description: Helps to provide essential needs to new moms and their children, and facilitates access to community resources.
service.application_process: Call or email for details, or online referral form available.

service.name: Apple Health
service.description: Free or low-cost health insurance. Coverage includes primary care, emergency visits, maternity services, pediatric care, dental services, vision care, prescription medications and more.
service.application_process: Apply for or renew your Apple Health coverage online through www.wahealthplanfinder.org, or call 1-855-923-4633

service.name: Homebuyer Education Class - Kulshan Community Land Trust
service.description: In six hours this free class will cover the homebuying process from the very beginning to move-in. Upon completion of the class participants will earn a certificate from the Washington State Housing Finance Commission (WSHFC). The certificate allows you to take advantage of special loan products and is a requirement for any of the WSHFC’s affordable loan products.
service.application_process: Pre-registration is required online.

service.name: Housing Choice Voucher Program
service.description: The Housing Choice Voucher program (Section 8) is the federal government’s major program for assisting very low-income families, the elderly, and the disabled to afford decent, safe, and sanitary housing in the private market. Program participants generally pay no more than 40% of their income for rent and utilities.
service.application_process: All applications are done online through the Applicant Portal.

service.name: BTC Dental Services
service.description: Reduced cost dental clinic offering the following services only: exams, x-rays, dental cleanings, sealants, and some simple fillings.
service.application_process: If you would like to be placed on the potential patient list, please email dental@btc.edu

service.name: Southside Food Bank
service.description: Provides food to anyone in need. Open the first and third Thursday of each month, 10 - 11:30 AM.

service.name: Parenting Education - Brigid Collins
service.description: Designed to meet the needs of busy parents, Brigid Collins offers affordable, customizable parent coaching and support. Both one-on-one coaching (with a free initial consultation) and group seminars are available.
service.application_process: Register online, by phone, or email.

service.name: Home Free
service.description: Reunites runaway, homeless and exploited youth with their family or legal guardian or helps them get to an alternative living arrangement (ALA), such as a community-based transitional living program, through a free bus ticket.

service.name: Community Inclusion and Services Program
service.description: Advocates for the provision of accommodations, services, treatment, and technology necessary to support the choices of people with disabilities to safely and meaningfully participate as equal citizens in any social, economic, or political aspect of community life.

service.name: Compass Health Adult Intensive Outpatient Program (IOP)
service.description: Serves individuals with severe and persistent behavioral health disorders whose needs are better met with more frequent contact and outreach. Goals of IOP include client reinforcement of safety, promotion of stability and independence of the individual in the community, and restoration and stabilization to a higher level of functioning.
service.application_process: Call to request an outpatient assessment

service.name: ​LGBT National ​Online Peer-Support Chat
service.description: An online chat space that is anonymous and confidential where you can connect with a trained LGBTQ peer support volunteer to have a conversation about many different issues and concerns including, but not limited to, coming out issues, gender and/or sexuality identities, relationship concerns, bullying, workplace issues, HIV/AIDS anxiety, safer sex information, suicide, and much more.

service.name: Learning Resources - BPL
service.description: Bellingham Public Library subscribes to online tools that help you to learn new skills using self-paced lessons. Tools include LinkedIN Learning for Library (self-paced courses on a wide variety of topics), Mango Languages (tools to learn 70+ languages, including courses for ESL learners), and Northstar Digital Literacy (everyday computer skills).

service.name: Child Care Aware of NW Washington
service.description: Provides families with information and referrals to licensed child care facilities and supports child care providers through coaching, technical assistance, behavioral consultation, and professional development opportunities.

service.name: Community Jobs Training Program - RE Store
service.description: Lowers barriers to employment in Bellingham by providing paid, on-site job training to economically disadvantaged members of our community.
service.application_process: Email for more information.

service.name: Foster Parent and Caregiver Support line
service.description: Provides phone support when foster parents and kinship caregivers are in crisis. DCYF caseworkers answer the calls and can offer behavior management advice, problem solving tips and a listening ear.

service.name: Youth After-School Program - ANT
service.description: 8-10 week long mental and behavioral health programs focused on helping young people ages 9-18 years old identify their feelings and needs, manage behaviors, overcome individual challenges and obstacles, set clear and attainable goals, and continually review progress towards meeting those goals.
service.application_process: Contact program coordinator via email or phone. If this program is determined to be a good fit, participants fill out the registration form and send form and deposit in mail to PO box. Scholarships available by completing the Financial Aid Application available online.
service.fees: Fees apply. Scholarships are awarded via Financial Aid Application, but require a minimum $50 quarterly payment.

service.name: Our Little Wishes Enrichment Program
service.description: Grants Little Wishes to children ages 6 to 18 for ongoing support of lessons and activities including, but not limited to, art lessons, music lessons, martial arts, team sports, swimming lessons, dance, gymnastics, ice skating, ice hockey, horseback riding, and soccer.​
service.application_process: Download application online.

service.name: Nooksack Valley Early Childhood Program
service.description: Serves families with children ages birth to five to ensure access to quality early childhood services for families in the Nooksack Valley School District. The focus of the birth to five programs is to support each and every child’s individual development, ensuring school readiness when entering kindergarten.

service.name: WTA Fixed Route
service.description: Fixed routes provide service to designated bus stops using large transit buses.​​ ​WTA provides service seven days a week, with more limited service on Saturdays, Sundays and evenings.​ Fixed routes serve Bellingham, Ferndale, Lynden, Blaine and Birch Bay, Lummi Nation, Sudden Valley, Kendall, Everson, Nooksack and Sumas.

service.name: Opportunity Council Homeless Housing Programs
service.description: Housing programs for individuals and families experiencing unsheltered homelessness, including short-term and permanent housing options. Apply through the Community Resource Center.
service.application_process: Contact the Community Resource Center to apply for services.

service.name: Whatcom Human Rights Task Force
service.description: Works to ensure an individual’s right to be treated with dignity and to live without fear of violence, intimidation, or discrimination based on group identification or personal characteristics. Such groups include, but are not limited to: race, ethnicity, gender, national origin, sexual orientation (gender expression/identity), religion, age, class, disability, veteran/military status or political opinion.

service.name: Supporting Parents of Autism
service.description: Support group focused on mental health counseling for parents who have children on the autism spectrum.
service.application_process: Register online, registration closes 5 days before the first meeting.

service.name: Oxford House View Ridge
service.description: Clean and sober housing for men.

service.name: Foster Parenting and Kinship Care
service.description: Services for foster parents and kinship caregivers, including help becoming a foster parent, and supports for current foster parents.

service.name: Research Tools - BPL
service.description: Bellingham Public Library subscribes to research tools that allow you to discover reliable, accurate information sources, including newspaper and magazine articles. You will need your Bellingham Public Library barcode and PIN to login to most of the tools.

service.name: Basics for Babies
service.description: Free diapers and wipes for babies and toddlers. Limit 15 diapers per child per month. Diapers are typically available in sizes 1 - 6, though availability may vary and is not guaranteed.

service.name: Amplifying Voices of Incarcerated Individuals with Disabilities (AVID)
service.description: A program focused on improving conditions, treatment, services, and reentry for people with disabilities who are incarcerated in our state’s jails and prisons, as well as those who reside at the Special Commitment Center. AVID works to ensure that those who are reentering the community have their voices heard and their rights protected.

service.name: Individual Counseling - TouchStone
service.description: Ages 18 and over. Experienced counselors treat many issues including depression, anxiety, anger management, sexual abuse, grief, self-injury, domestic violence, family conflict, oppositional defiance, poor self-esteem, suicidal ideation, and trauma.
service.fees: All insurance providers accepted, sliding scale available if no insurance.

service.name: Sea Mar WIC and Nutrition Program
service.description: WIC is a supplemental food and nutrition/breastfeeding education program that helps pregnant women, new mothers and young children eat well, learn about nutrition and breastfeeding, and stay healthy.

service.name: PeaceHealth Immediate Primary and Urgent Care
service.description: Walk-in and same-day primary care services. Conditions treated include asthma, balance issues, ear problems, food allergies & sensitivities, insect bites & stings, minor aches & pains, minor infections, minor injuries, nasal & sinus problems, and routine illnesses.

service.name: Spay Neuter Assistance Program (SNAP) - WHS
service.description: A low-cost spay and neuter program for income-eligible applicants. If you are interested in having your companion animal spayed or neutered, please download the SNAP application online and email completed application to adoptions@whatcomhumane.org.
service.application_process: Fill out the SNAP application (available online) and email to adoptions@whatcomhumane.org. If you qualify, you will automatically be added to a call-back list and WHS will contact you to review your application, discuss payment options, and schedule an appointment for your animal.
service.wait_time: Due to reduced staffing levels and resources, appointments are booked out 3-4 months depending on the animal’s breed, sex, and weight.

service.name: DVSAS 24-Hour Helpline
service.description: Advocacy counselors provide safety planning, emotional support, crisis intervention, and referrals through the helpline 24 hours a day, 365 days a year.

service.name: Geriatric Transition Program
service.description: Helps adults with challenging behaviors transition from a hospital to a long term care facility that meets their needs. This program is for adults with serious mental illness, dementia, mood disorder or other neurological disorders. Eligible adults also have challenging behaviors which are a barrier to hospital discharge OR their long term care facility placement is at risk due to challenging behaviors.

service.name: Medicare Part B (Medical Insurance)
service.description: Helps cover services from doctors and other health care providers, outpatient care, home health care, durable medical equipment (wheelchairs, walkers, hospital beds, and other equipment), and many preventive services (screenings, shots or vaccines, and yearly “Wellness” visits). (Included in Original Medicare)

service.name: Wraparound with Intensive Services (WISe)
service.description: Intensive outpatient mental health program. Provides home and community based wraparound services for Medicaid-eligible youth (up to 20 years) with multiple and complex needs.
service.application_process: Anyone can call and ask for a WISe screen. Youth 13 years and older and their families must consent to services.

service.name: Good Neighbor Project
service.description: Project designed to enhance the neighborhood feel, build a community-partnered response to homelessness, and mitigate potential challenges arising from Base Camp’s downtown location. Services include a Downtown Bellingham Liaison available to support downtown residents and businesses with issues related to homelessness, an Incident/Concern Matrix tool to help business in their interactions with neighbors experiencing homelessness, dedicated litter patrol, bi-weekly Neighbor Advisory forum, de-escalation training, and more.

service.name: On-going Therapy - Dawson Place
service.description: On-going therapy services provided for any child victim who has received services from Dawson Place, up to the age of 22 depending on the needs of the client. Group, individual, and family therapy sessions also available.
service.application_process: Call for information

service.name: Early Support for Infants and Toddlers - WCEL
service.description: Serves families with children from birth to three years old who have developmental delays or disabilities in order to maximize each child’s development.

service.name: Volunteer Programs - WHS
service.description: Whatcom Humane Society cares for thousands of animals each year, and couldn’t do it without the help of dedicated volunteers. If you are interested in becoming a WHS volunteer, please read through the Volunteer Requirements and How to Get Started steps online.
service.application_process: The WHS Volunteer Application is available online, but please read through the Volunteer Requirements and How to Get Started steps for more information.

service.name: Grief Support Resource Library
service.description: The death of a family member, friend, or other significant person is a lifelong loss for children. The Grief Support Resource Library was created as an online tool for those supporting a child who is grieving.

service.name: Stewards of Children
service.description: Program that educates adults to recognize and react responsibly to child sexual abuse. It is the only child abuse prevention program shown to increase awareness of child sexual abuse, improve attitudes about adult responsibility and increase protective behaviors. Trainings are offered to the public each month, and facilitators are available to provide trainings for any group of six or more.
service.application_process: Register online, or call for assistance.

service.name: Lydia Place Family Housing
service.description: Family Housing programs include Permanent Supportive Housing (PSH), Rapid Re-housing (RRH), and Emergency Hotel Stays for families experiencing homelessness. Contact Opportunity Council to apply.
service.application_process: Visit Opportunity Council to apply for housing programs.

service.name: Parent Coaching - Parenting Academy
service.description: Meet with a parenting coach for 50 minutes to discuss the unique goals you have for yourself, your child, and family, along with parenting strategies, and more.
service.fees: Fees apply. Insurance accepted, scholarships available.

service.name: Shower Connect
service.description: Gives people who are homeless access to warm showers. The mobile shower truck has two separate units, each with a shower, toilet, and sink.

service.name: LGBT National Youth Talkline
service.description: Anonymous and confidential hotline where young callers under 25 years of age can speak on many different issues and concerns including, but not limited to, coming out issues, gender and/or sexuality identities, relationship concerns, bullying, isolation, anxiety at school, family issues, HIV/AIDS concerns, safer sex information, suicide, and much more.

service.name: Washington Warm Line
service.description: Peer support help line for people living with emotional and mental health challenges. Calls are answered by specially-trained volunteers who have lived experience with mental health challenges. All calls are confidential.

service.name: Nooksack Youth and Family Services Department
service.description: Provides an array of advocacy and case management services to Nooksack children and families involving child welfare, domestic violence, sexual assault, and elder abuse. Programs include Indian Child Welfare Program and Independent Living, Extended Foster Care, Tl’ils Ta’á’altha Program, Men and Boys Outreach and Advocacy Program, Supervised Visitation and Safe Exchange Program, and Child Protection Team.

service.name: Lummi Tribal Health Center
service.description: Services include adult and family medicine, pediatrics, gynecologic and reproductive care, Maternal Support Services (MSS) and WIC, psychiatry, dental and orthodontics, geriatrics and home visits, physical therapy, cognitive behavioral therapy, counseling for parent-child relationship improvement, dive and work physicals, pharmacy, lab and Xray, COVID testing and vaccines, and rheumatology.

service.name: Social Security Number and Card
service.description: Replace a Social Secuirty card if it's lost, stolen, or damaged; request a Social Security number if you don't have one; and report a stolen Social Security number if you suspect it's being used by someone else.

service.name: DVSAS Safe Housing Program
service.description: Provides safe, confidential shelter to individuals and families fleeing domestic violence. Clients have access to basic food, clothing, personal items, and bedding if needed. Advocates are available to conduct intakes and provide advocacy twenty-four hours a day. Shelter is available for all survivors. This program is accessible to persons with disabilities and accepts service animals. Other pets may be accepted on a case by case basis.

service.name: PACT Program - LWC
service.description: Recovery-oriented mental health service for individuals with severe and persistent mental illnesses, often with co-occurring substance use disorder. Services are comprehensive, highly individualized, and modified as needed through an ongoing assessment and treatment planning process based on the needs of the individuals served.

service.name: Senior Community Meals - Ferndale
service.description: Meals are offered on a donation-only basis to adults age 60+ (suggested donation $5.00). Others will be charged the full cost of the meal ($8.50). Senior Center membership not required to participate in the meal program. Frozen to-go meals available Wednesdays, 11:30 AM - 12:00 PM.

service.name: McKinney-Vento Program - LSD
service.description: Serves students experiencing homelessness. This program is designed to reduce isolation, maximize stability and maintain consistency for this population of children and youth. Contact the liaison in your school district for support.

service.name: PeaceHealth Family Medicine
service.description: PeaceHealth’s family medicine team is here for you through all life stages. The primary care doctor in a family practice is trained in both pediatric and adult medicine. This makes it perfect for families who want care conveniently delivered in the same clinic. Patients can see the same doctor for care from childhood through adulthood.

service.name: Trans Teen Online Chat Room
service.description: Weekly moderated chat rooms for LGBTQ young people ages 19 and younger to talk together in a safe space, and to express themselves.

service.name: Peer Pathfinder Program - Lifeline Connections
service.description: Certified Peer Specialists provide recovery support to adults who have an opiate and/or stimulant use disorder and experience or are at risk of homelessness. Peer specialists have lived experience of substance use and mental health recovery and are trained to provide support services.

service.name: Stable Home Mediation Program (Foreclosure Mediation)
service.description: The goal of foreclosure mediation is for homeowners to have an opportunity to discuss options as alternatives to foreclosure, to provide parties with the ability to review programs that could assist in continued payment of mortgages, to review documentation with their bank or lender, and as a last resort, to discuss opportunities and timelines for a “graceful exit” from their homes.
service.application_process: Must be referred to Department of Commerce by a housing counselor or an attorney. Contact a free housing counselor at 1-877-894-HOME (4663).

service.name: Meridian Transitional Kindergarten
service.description: A free transitional kindergarten for students who are scheduled to enter kindergarten in the upcoming fall. Students must be 4 years old prior to August 31 to be eligible for the current school year.

service.name: LGBT Teen Online Chat Room
service.description: Weekly moderated chat rooms for LGBTQ young people ages 19 and younger to talk together in a safe space, and to express themselves.

service.name: BPL Calendar
service.description: Calendar of Bellingham Public Library events, including story times, SkillShare sessions, classes, and community events.

service.name: Washington Landlord Association
service.description:
Committed to protecting landlords' property rights and their ability to 
manage their rentals.

service.name: Agape Home
service.description: A faith-based addiction recovery program for women. In addition to shelter and relapse prevention, services include one-on-one case management, family focused care plans, connections to resources, life skills classes, work therapy, behavioral health referrals, and more.
service.application_process: File out an application online, then follow the instructions on the form to submit it.

service.name: Parent Support Groups - PREPARES
service.description: Parent Support Groups provide regular meetings and activities with other parents to enhance parenting skills and provide a supportive environment for one another.
service.application_process: Call or email for details, or online referral form available.

service.name: Cascade Christian Home
service.description: Community home for adults with developmental disabilities.

service.name: Sea Mar Bellingham Behavioral Health Clinic
service.description: A state-licensed community mental health agency. Provides chemical dependency services, mental health services, and medication assisted treatment (MAT).

service.name: Affordable Housing Programs - BHA
service.description: Serving families, seniors, and those with disabilities. Units are offered based on availability. Households generally pay 30% of their income for rent. Each property has its own application process; visit the Applicant Portals page to begin the application process.
service.application_process: All applications are done on a Property Basis. Please view the list of properties in this program to determine which property you wish to apply for then visit the Applicant Portals page to begin the application process.

service.name: WABC Quality of Life Resources
service.description: Improve your quality of life with helpful information about a variety of basic needs and community resources including employment, education, housing, health access, and food.

service.name: Title I Preschool - BPS
service.description: Free, half-day preschool program focused on basic academic and social skills in preparation for kindergarten. Students qualify based on space, ability, and academic and financial need.
service.application_process: Complete the online registration form.

service.name: Parents of Adolescents and Teens Program
service.description: Virtual program open to solo parents and caregivers, couples, and co-parents, with children aged 10-19 years. Adult participants attend without adolescents and teens in attendance. Groups meet 2 hours, once a week, for 9 consecutive weeks.
service.fees: Sliding scale, flexible pricing. Call for details.

service.name: Foothills Food Bank Winter and Spring Pantry
